scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate your input regarding the ad experience affecting your gameplay. scraped_reviews.content: Playing this just feels bad. There seems to be both an internal timer for the ads (If you haven'tgotten one in X seconds, you get one after your next number) and also a counter that you get an ad after every X numbers placed, and the result is literally an ad after every 2 or 3 numbers for me. In addition, ads do not close properly, hitting the X button does not close the ads. Just really bad design that makes me actively avoid using an otherwise decent app.

scraped_reviews.content: Great for casual play, there's just 2 things that I wish it had. One of them is dark mode because the white is like a flash bang at first. the sudokus are great, lots of customization of tools to make it feel more or less like playing with pen and paper. but i got 4 ads over the course of a ten minute puzzle, one of which needed to open the google store overlay to close (which means a yound kid would easily be able to buy something without permission) and one had a fake x to close the ad which opened a tab in my browser, closing the app which takes a while to launch on my old phone. Get rid of the scummy ads, and one 1 per sudoku.

scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We appreciate your feedback regarding the ads. While we recognise they can be bothersome, they support keeping the game free for all. We're continually enhancing the ad experience. Additionally, you can remove all ads in Settings for a one-time fee of 12.99 Euros. Please contact us via the "Help" section in the app with any questions.

scraped_reviews.content: I initially liked this very much - but after the first few games I played, it started playing ads WHILE I was working on the puzzle. interrupting my puzzle for an ad is a BIG NO for me. seriously it takes me no more than 3 minutes to finish an easy puzzle, you can't even wait that long to play me an ad?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thank you for your feedback about the ad frequency during gameplay. We aim to find the right balance. Your insights are essential in enhancing user experience. We appreciate your thoughts. They help us provide the best gaming environment for all players.

scraped_reviews.content: I feel like I'm watching ads to occasionally play a game. Ads when I launch the game, ads when you fill out a number within the puzzle, ads after the level. And they are the same lengthy repetitive ads. From time to time, the ads will freeze, causing me to close out the game entirely. I just completed a level in 5:28, according to the game. It took over 13 minutes of real time because of the ads.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Mark! Thank you for sharing your thoughts. Your feedback regarding the ad experience is valuable, and we continuously strive to enhance balance and improve your experience in the app.

scraped_reviews.content: Used to love this game, had it installed for years across multiple phones. Now its so riddled with ads that you cant even start a puzzle without being hit by an ad. Then you get interrupted multiple times by ads, and once again when you finish a puzzle. It's beyond egregious. $15 to remove them as well, I am uninstalling permanently due to this absolute nonsense.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Travis! Thank you for letting us know your thoughts. We recognise your concerns about ad frequency and removal pricing. Your feedback is key to creating a more balanced and enjoyable experience. We truly value your support and will continue working to improve the game.

scraped_reviews.content: I've ran into 12 puzzles that blatantly violate the BASIC RULE of no repeat numbers in the same box or row. Months later and 10 more new puzzles found that are impossible by the rules of the game. Submitted examples and amazing crickets. App has gotten worse in the last 2 years. Now note mode randomly switches back to regular input without any direct intervention. Probably a way to force more adds
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Andrew! We apologise for the issues you've encountered with the puzzles and the note mode. Your feedback is important to us, and we encourage you to contact us via the "Help" section in the app for assistance. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

scraped_reviews.content: Almost a perfect game, but automatically unlocking the higher difficulties & not being able to turn them back off is annoying. "Extreme" difficulty is not fun but i now have to play extreme levels if i want to do the daily challenges and events. Just because i CAN beat it doesn't mean i want to deal with it. Please let us toggle difficulties after they're unlocked. I'm sure some people would like to only play higher difficulties, too.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We appreciate your feedback about the difficulty levels. The logic of daily challenge-level contribution is based on your usual games. If you do not play the regular games occasionally, the difficulty level for daily challenges will be reset. Don't hesitate to contact us via the "Help" section in the app with other issues.

scraped_reviews.content: Doesn't have ads for a while after a fresh install, then once you're comfortable will start throwing ads your way rapid-fire in the middle of a game while you're trying to think, some of which are 30 seconds or so long. Practically unusable at that point. I understand ads are useful for supporting the app, but keep them out of the way of the game itself, especially when the games are timed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. Thank you for your feedback. We‚Äôre sorry that the frequency of ads affects your enjoyment of the game. We're working to improve the balance between ads and gameplay. We hope to make it even better for you.

scraped_reviews.content: too many ads. ads when pausing and resuming, ads when finding all spots of a number correct, ads after finding all of multiple numbers, ads between matches. the website has none of this in the exact same format. Just go to their website and you'll have a better experience. if you wanted to use the app with no ads, that'll be $10, create the problem, and sell the solution. in order to play the higher difficulty boards, you need to play so many of the previous tier. The website doesn't do this
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Robert! Thank you for sharing your feedback. We recognise the challenges with the ad experience and are actively working to balance a free app with a seamless player experience. Our progressive difficulty system aims to assist new players in skill development. Your input is appreciated.

scraped_reviews.content: Glitchy and so many ads. I just downloaded the game and was able to play a few games before the ads started. That's how they reel you in. I couldn't even finish the last game I started due to ads. I got 3 pop-up ads DURING a game, and the last one didn't give me the option to continue past it. I abhor games that play the trick of making it seem like they have less ads than they actually do. I get you need money, but that is ridiculous. Uninstalled. Do better.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Rachael! Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate your concern regarding the ads interrupting your gameplay early on. We're actively enhancing the balance between ads and the gaming experience. We're sad to see you go, but thank you for trying the game.

scraped_reviews.content: When I searched for a sudoku game, under this game, it said "ad free". I download, open and play the game, and I see ads. That's false advertisement. So, don't pitch to me about "ads help keep the game free". All app developers use this excuse to make quick money instead of putting a low price on the app or making it free and ad free. There are free apps that don't have ads. It's 2025. Figure out a smarter way to make money. Ads are lazy.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We understand your frustration with the ads and interruptions. Our game does have ads to support its free availability. However, we offer an option to remove ads for a one-time fee, which can be found in the settings. This will provide an uninterrupted gameplay experience.

scraped_reviews.content: controls don't allow for filling in the same number on multiple squares. You have to keep clicking the square then the number. This problem solved, controls are good. The ads are overpowering. I did a hard puzzle, took 6 minutes, there were 4 ads plus the one at the begining and one at the end. I understand you are making a living, but you cant even get a feel for the game. I am one to pay for apps if I like them but I can't get a flow for how well it works.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ben! Thank you for your feedback! We understand how frustrating frequent ads and limited controls can be. We‚Äôre always working to improve the gameplay experience, and your input helps us prioritise future updates. If you have any additional thoughts or feature requests, please get in touch with us via the ‚ÄúHelp‚Äù section in the app.

scraped_reviews.content: This has one of the better experiences of the sudoku apps put there but some serious flaws that bring down its rating. Just about any time I'm stuck, and resort to a hint, it recommends Bowman's Bingo which is effectively brute forcing the puzzle. I would like to see more advanced techniques to be added. The other thing is that only one notes mode is supported, which makes tracking more advanced techniques difficult.

title: Fitbod: Workout & Gym Planner
description:
Build muscle, gain strength and lose weight with optimized weight lifting routines. You won‚Äôt just get stronger‚Äîyou‚Äôll do it on your terms, with a little help from AI. Fitbod is a personalized workout planner that uses AI to help you make progress. Each training session is custom-built for your fitness level, goals and home or gym workout equipment. Make lasting progress with your own AI trainer guiding you to be stronger and healthier

Whether you're focused on a gym workout or prefer the convenience of a home workout, Fitbod‚Äôs AI adapts to your fitness journey. The app learns from your preferences and past performance to build personalized workout plans. Plus, the built-in fitness and health tracker monitors your progress, making sure you hit your goals with the right exercises for your body. You can tailor each workout to match your available equipment and even adjust routines to target specific muscle groups, ensuring you always stay on track.

Fitness Planning, Just for You - A Personalized Workout Plan Designed to Push Your Limits

‚óÜ Gym and home workout planner, all with the help of AI
‚óÜ Optimized resistance training and workouts
‚óÜ Ability to select available gym workout equipment
‚óÜ Fitness tracker for all your workouts and routines
‚óÜ Health tracker to help you track recovery, weight loss and more
‚óÜ Automatic strength training and workout optimization
‚óÜ Workout recommendations powered by machine learning
‚óÜ Personalized workouts, based on training style

AI-Generated Workouts

‚óÜ Effective gym and home workouts, customized to your fitness goals
‚óÜ Maximizes fitness tracker data by varying and balancing exercises with AI
‚óÜ Adaptive AI learns from your edits to its workout recommendations
‚óÜ Non-linear periodization to optimize your workouts for sustained progress
‚óÜ Advanced, intermediate, and beginner fitness levels
‚óÜ Variety of workout modifiers for each session
‚óÜ Save, build or use your favorite strength training workouts
‚óÜ Pro fitness trainers available via email for all strength training questions

Workout at the Gym or at Home - Over 1000+ Exercises

‚óÜ Hi-res, multi-angle videos of each fitness exercise
‚óÜ Easy-to-understand, detailed exercise instructions
‚óÜ Search exercises by muscle group, equipment type or keyword
‚óÜ Cardio, mobility, pregnancy-safe exercises and more
‚óÜ Consistent updates made to optimize the exercise library

Integrations

‚óÜ Integrated with Wear OS, with quick access to your workout with the Tile

Privacy Policy: https://www.fitbod.me/privacy-policy
Terms of Use: https://www.fitbod.me/terms-conditions
California Privacy Rights: https://www.fitbod.me/ccpa-privacy-policy
Support: http://fitbod.me/support

Join the Fitbod Community:
Instagram: instagram.com/fitbodapp/
Twitter: twitter.com/fitbodApp
Facebook: facebook.com/fitbodapp

summary: Gym & home workout plans with strength training, exercise tracking, HIIT & more.

scraped_reviews.content: Seems pretty good but unfortunate you have to pay for it to unlock all the benefits/full range use (which I know is common these days) but for a workout app, being 8$/ month or almost $100 annually seems too high. It might show it but I haven't seen yet where it shows your reps and sets when you log your workout which is too bad since that's a decent part about tracking workouts.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review & feedback, we appreciate it! In the workout tab you can see the sets & reps for each exercise. After you log the workout, you can see all the details from the Log tab - you can click into any workout you'd like to review! fitbod.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/12732749777047-Fitbod-Metrics-Records#h_01GTAMZRMQ1CXFZA1XVVED9RB3

scraped_reviews.content: glad I used the free trial in its entirety before making my decision. the first workout was amazing. the second and third workouts were terrible. the second one was way too easy and the third had things I simply can't do. for example (though not the only issue) I am not capable of doing push ups. my wrists cannot support that movement. I tried to replace the exercise and the only options were harder versions of push ups. I stopped the workout part way through because of that. disappointing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! When you first start with the app, it takes some time for the algorithm to calibrate to you, you do want to adjust reps/weight as needed so the app can learn from this and optimize your future suggestions. When replacing an exercise, you'll first see a list of "best" exercises but you can choose other options outside that.

scraped_reviews.content: 2nd Review: It seems they listen to their customers. They fixed/changed things from my last review and I appreciate it; however, I do want to give more feedback. If we could set the max weight we own, that would be awesome. Example: I only own up to 20 lbs in dumbells, but I cannot set that anywhere I find. It always adds extra weight and I have to set it back. Not a big deal, but it can get tedious after a bit. Last feedback: the "log all sets" button should have a warning after press.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We always strive to continue improving the app, so we greatly appreciate you sharing your experience & feedback! We actually added in a custom weight feature for small weights this year! You can go to your Gym Profile > Available Equipment > Tap "Edit" on the dumbbell option to edit your weights. I've also noted your feedback for a warning :)

scraped_reviews.content: Great variety of workouts, poor implementation so far. when you sign up it asks questions about equipment you have available, but it still assumes a ton of equipment it doesn't ask about. you can then go into the settings and remove all equipment you don't have, but it doesn't stick. I've had to multiple times go back into the settings and again remove equipment so I don't get a suggested workout with half the lifts requiring equipment I don't have. please get better at this folks.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Nikko, thanks for your review and we apologize for the trouble. This is not intended behavior, please email our Support team at support@fitbod.me so we can best assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: I had this app for a while, but really only got serious again earlier this year after a long break. It has been an absolute game changer. I love the way it lets me customize when, what, and how I want to work out, and it's even amazing when traveling because I can tell it what is available to keep my workouts going. I recommend the app to everyone I talk to!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for the awesome review and for recommending us, Christopher! We're thrilled you enjoy the app and all the customizable features :)

scraped_reviews.content: My workouts were getting stale after years of the push/pull/legs splits and I had plateaud a while ago. This app gave me totally new splits and exercises that had never occured to me before. I'm now stronger and look better than I have ever been and I'm in my early 40s. It pushes me each workout and allows each muscle group the right amount of time to recover. Only small complaint is there is not way to export the raw data. I would love to be able to plug a CVS file in Excel. Great app üëç
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review, Trey, we're thrilled you're feeling stronger than ever! If you'd like, you can email our team at support@fitbod.me about exporting your data. We appreciate your support!

scraped_reviews.content: feeling great! üëç the app selects the exercises with plenty of variety and customizable everything and records it all. I used to write my workouts in books üìö I still have them somewhere. returning to exercise feels üí™ after a break. The app takes much of the stress out of hitting the muscles groups, using the bars and weights and bands etc. I told it I have. I'm feeling much stronger and confident and looking forward to the next workout!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your 5-star review, Kevin! We're glad Fitbod takes the stress out of building balanced workouts and that you're feeling stronger and even more confident :) We appreciate your support!

scraped_reviews.content: Classic bait-and-switch. Looks good, gets you hyped, makes one workout then slaps you with "unlock your next workout with a free trial!" insinuating it's a paid only app, but only after you give them all your information, then make it impossible to delete you account and remove info from their servers. This app wants nothing more than to sell your data and workouts that almost exactly match what a planet fitness membership gives you. You replied. how about put a button to delete in the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: When you first download the app we provide a free trial so you can explore what Fitbod has to offer. After the trial, a monthly or yearly subscription helps support ongoing improvements. We do not sell your data. Find steps on deleting your account here: https://fitbod.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/19559573010583-How-to-Delete-Your-Fitbod-Account

scraped_reviews.content: Great app! Paying for the subscription imo is way worth it. The ease of tracking and planning is amazing. An option to recommend new or different exercises would be great (Updated) They fixed a lot of small issues that made the app even better. Glad to see they update and work on the app. Still waiting for a simple fix for weighted walks. No way to walk with weight and log it. Nah, I'll just keep telling the app I do 4 mile farmers walks untill you fix the damn thing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review, Ben, happy to hear you find the tracking and planning helpful with Fitbod! For any exercise you'd like to see added, like the weighted walks, you can create a custom exercise! Our team is monitoring these to help decide what to add to our database next :) fitbod.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/28062570249623-Custom-Exercises

scraped_reviews.content: I like the app, specifically the progressive load algorithm. however, I find that it increases weight much too fast. possibly because I have it on hypertrophy advanced. increasing the weigh every week doesn't seem realistic, at least for me. It's not a huge deal as I can just adjust the weight. just looking for a tad more personalization. perhaps an AI prompt
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ryan, thanks for your feedback, we're glad you enjoy the app! We'd be happy to take a look at your weight recommendations to make sure everything is in order if you email us about that at support@fitbod.me.

scraped_reviews.content: As close to having a personal trainer as you can get, without someone over your shoulder. I REALLY LIKE that I made a suggestion to the help desk and within a month, Fitbod sent me an email letting me know that my suggestion was incorporated into the app and released. I like that they ask what equipment you have, and then tailor to that. I like that you can substitute exercises if needed, or add, change weights, whatever. I like the timing function to keep your rest periods. FRIGGIN WOW!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the awesome review, Wayne! We're happy to be your gym buddy and are glad you enjoy the different gym profile settings and customizable options within the app :)

scraped_reviews.content: I've used fitbod for a few months now. at first, it was good. not anymore. here are the main issues: 1. rather than adding weight to an exercise, it will seemingly limitlessly increase reps instead. this has led to workouts like 5 sets of 36 reps of air squats, for example. 2. a few weeks ago, barbell exercises broke completely. the app no longer recommends anything over 45 lbs despite me having an extensive history of lifting more weight. I have to manually adjust every workout.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review! The app will not recommend weight for bodyweight exercises, so we'd recommend replacing that with something like the dumbbell squat instead, for example. We recently added custom weights for barbells and plates so you'll want to go into your Gym Profile > Available Weight > Confirm you have the correct weights selected.

scraped_reviews.content: It's been a great app overall. The only suggestion I could possibly make is that the rest periods don't track on the watch, so I have to have my phone out. There's also some equipment at my gym that I can't add in the app. That said, it creates great workouts and does a good job rotating muscle groups and building up.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review and feedback, Krystina! I've noted your suggestion for our Product team so this can be considered for the future. With any missing equipment, you could create custom exercises in the meantime for that (just leave the equipment field blank): https://fitbod.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/28062570249623-Custom-Exercises

scraped_reviews.content: I really love this app, though for the loop bands it would be great if we could set the tension for them because all bands are different tension from different companies, I have rubberbanditz and they are all different, also, stepping on the full loop band for biceps would be a great workout add. edit. I mean the tension of that bands color example, black is 20-50 pounds, orange 5-15 pounds.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: So glad you love the app, David, we appreciate your review! The great news is you can customize your color & tension pairs - steps on how to do that here: https://fitbod.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4404204105367-Resistance-Bands-Collections

scraped_reviews.content: I really like the workout plans. I have been using it for a little over a year and I think it's incredibly worth it. If the developers read this, this is the best workout app I have used! Recommended to tons of friends. Edit 7/6/2025 Three years later and still using the app! Nearly 500 workouts and still going, instrumental in my weight loss! Thank you! Stop messing with the UI üòÇ
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review, Luke, we're incredibly honored that you've been a part of Fitbod for almost 500 workouts! We'd love to hear more of your thoughts on the UI if you want to email us about this at feedback@fitbod.me. In any case, we thank you for your continued support :)

scraped_reviews.content: I've only been using the app for a couple of days and can already tell it's perfect for what I need. The hardest thing for me when going to the gym was figuring out what to do and this does that for me and mixes in different muscle groups so I don't overwork one area. I have downloaded SO many lifting apps and finally found one that'll work for me!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're so glad Fitbod has been the one for you, Sara! We're happy to be your gym buddy to take the guesswork out of your fitness. Thank you so much for your review and support!

scraped_reviews.content: It is easy to swap out exercises, and I like the rest timer. However, it takes a very long time to show up in my Fit app after syncing. It also installs an app on my watch, but doesn't stay open or give me relevant information (like heart rate and calories burned) during the workout. That did end up showing up in the workout log, but would be good to see during the workout.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review and feedback, Wendy! We're glad you enjoy the easy replace option and rest timer. I've noted your suggestion to display heart rate and calories burned so this can be considered for the future. We appreciate you sharing your insights!

scraped_reviews.content: it was better before the recent update. i liked being able to add exercises NEXT, instead of LAST, in the list. at least let us choose our preference. now i have to drag each thing up into the correct order after adding. it's cumbersome. also not a fan of it asking additional questions every time i remove/change something. i understand this is to help your algo; but it's too intrusive, and it frequently doesn't even work. if i select "delete and don't recommend," it doesn't delete.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us, Emily! I've noted your thoughts down for our product team. With the delete option not working, please report this to our Support team at support@fitbod.me so we can investigate further.

scraped_reviews.content: I enjoy this app very much. The workouts are diverse, and the instructions are clear. One feature I would suggest to the developers is a PR diagnostic workout so that all muscle groups could have the perfect weight for the workouts. I have found that the weight called for in my workouts can sometimes be too light or too heavy. I work out every morning, so that may be contributing to it. I can't wait to see what other feature you have planned for the future.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a ton for the 5 stars, Joseph!! We do have a Max Effort Day feature which is intended to work like you mention and help calibrate your weight suggestions, check it out here: https://fitbod.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360033675553-Max-Effort-Day

scraped_reviews.content: LOVE this app. I'm the type that needs someone to push me at the gym, and this app solves that. You can set your workout duration, and it populates a workout for you based on your preferences. Then, it records the weight you use for each exercise and pushes you to increase your weight the next time. Keeps me motivated and from feeling lost at what to do. This app has helped me get the most out of my workouts and is totally worth paying for.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a ton for the 5 stars, Jessica! We're glad to see you enjoy the customizable options and that the app keeps you motivated while removing the guesswork from your fitness. Keep crushing those workouts :)

scraped_reviews.content: I was asked to fill out all my info, including my email, before being shown the pricing. That felt like a bait-and-switch. I expected to see the pricing before sharing my email‚Äînot be lured into giving it first. Then probably comes the promotional emails I never asked for. This approach is frustrating and unprofessional. It turned me off from using the app entirely.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for the frustrations, Ahmad. We do have our pricing available on our website to view anytime at https://app.fitbod.me/ I've noted your feedback for our team as well!

scraped_reviews.content: Concept is great, but execution is half-baked. Been using this for a year or so(?) They keep saying they're excited to launch the new Android version while we're still without a lot of the (apparent) iOS features and integrations... still paying for a full app though. I do like how the workouts adjust based on the calculated fatigue of each muscle group and the easy-to-use rest periods during exercise. Maybe other apps do this, but I've been too lazy until now to look into it; this does good enough, but it's not as cool as you see it advertised.

Great application, with some caveats. The Good I like the way you can select a workout by intensity, muscle group, available equipment, etc. I like the instructional videos and historical tracking The Bad You are limited to the exercises included in the database. There's a spot where you can request an exercise be added, I have done this a couple of times, but none of them have been added. No combo moves, limited variations, etc. customer service not responsive. Bummer for $80/year.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the review! We're glad you've been enjoying the customizable settings, tracking, and exercise videos. I've also noted your feedback for our Product team to consider for the future. Our Support Team responds to every message though sometimes it can take a bit longer due to high volume, you may also want to check SPAM just in case!

scraped_reviews.content: I love the app and it's what i was looking for. It does an awesome job at recommending workouts based on a brunch of different and relevant criteria, which can also be easily customized. Love the integration with Health Connect. Some UI elements and interactions are not the most intuitive. Example: When doing Supersets/Circuits, the transition from one exercise to another is confusing and jarring. Some variety between rep-based sets and time-based sets for the same workouts would be cool.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're thrilled to hear you love the app, William! I've documented your feedback for our Product team, we appreciate you sharing. And it's great to see that you enjoy the different customizable features and Health Connect integration! Thanks for your review and feel free to share any additional feedback along the way with us at feedback@fitbod.me :)

scraped_reviews.content: Brilliantly designed app. Been using about two weeks, and I can already feel and see some results. You can adjust almost everything about your workout, and the app does a great job of providing some necessary guidance. The demonstration videos for every exercise are also simple and informative. I wish the workout timer were visible at all times, as I often forget to restart it, and I don't understand why it's impossible to add certain accessory groups like forearms. But overall, super helpful.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to share your experience, Bradley! It's fantastic to see that you enjoy the customizable options and exercise videos/instructions. If you're having trouble adding forearms, this may be due to Gym Profile settings, you can try increasing your duration a bit. If you still have trouble, message us at support@fitbod.me.

scraped_reviews.content: I love the app but I do think that the heavy bag should be added, possibly boxing and kickboxing separately and the ability to pause the workout (I do my warmups at home and it's a 10-15 minute drive to the gym but I can't pause in between). More workouts would be cool too but that's my only gripe. Very easy and user friendly. Takes the guesswork out of everything. A perfect app for those that love to workout but either get bored with their workouts or get to the gym and can't decide what to do.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Justin, you can request any equipment/exercises that you'd like to see added here: https://fitbod.me/new-exercise-request/üí™ We're so glad you love the app and that you feel it's perfect for taking the guesswork out while giving you fresh workouts that won't leave you bored! Thank you for your feedback :)

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using the app for years and love it. The quick ability to replace a routine is key when I'm looking to tweak the recommended workout. And I love that it pushes me over time with more weights, sets, or exercises. My biggest complaint (several years running now) is that Strava Sync still doesn't exist on Android. Given all my other apps have this, this may eventually become a deal breaker for me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your review, Marc, it's great to hear you love the app! We recently introduced the Health Connect integration which allows greater support in indirectly syncing to any other app that also supports Health Connect. We've also noted your feedback on this for our team!

scraped_reviews.content: The ability to switch workouts you don't want with ones you do is a plus and I like the variety, but I've been having Health Connect issues. I can't seem to get the calories burned to show up correctly on Samsung Health with all permissions granted. I also like the Android Wear app, but a suggestion I have is when you finish a rep and click it on the watch, it should automatically go to the next one on your phone (unless I don't have it set up correctly). Overall, it is a great app
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your review, Dominique! It's great to see you enjoy the flexibility with replacing exercises. I've also made note of your feedback for our Product team. With your Health Connect issues, please message our Support team at support@fitbod.me and we'll be happy to help!

scraped_reviews.content: I loved the app. Paid the premium. Arm and chest workouts are awesome but the legs and hamstrings are killing me. It's all Romanian, they make no sense, not simple for beginners, and if someone has back problems you automatically work the wrong muscles because you can't push the way they want you to or you can't feel the burn at all. Put in actual squats as I can't find them. And please add real variety for legs. Well rounded workout is the expectation of the app. Not just upper body.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Christopher, thanks for your review! We do have many squat options within the app and if you'd prefer to avoid the Romanian deadlifts, you can tap the "..." to the right of the exercise in the workout list > Don't recommend again. Feel free to reach out to our team at support@fitbod.me so we can look into your suggestions further for you!

scraped_reviews.content: Great app, been using it for a few months now. I have an android and it sounds like IOS gets better features, but if I didn't check the reviews I wouldn't know any better. Great at tracking, demonstrating, and auto calculating. Only 4 stars because it glitches out rarely. (Got logged out, erased my days data) only recommendation is to add a meal and diet side to the app. Separate, but the same. I will note that the replacement option is limiting but can be manually entered in otherwise.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Dakota! Thank you for your review and feedback! üëäüèΩ‚ú® If you continue to notice these issues, please reach us at reviews@fitbod.me and we'd love to assist you further with this.

scraped_reviews.content: It's great once you learn how to use the app. A tutorial would have saved me a bit of time. The only complaint I have is the pricing. It's affordable, just no free but with ads option. I would not mind an ad on the corner or side of the screen while I'm working out. Or a 30 sec commercial playing on my rest periods between sets to make it free. But again, its rates are affordable so it's pretty good.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, Daniel! We appreciate you supporting Fitbod with your review (:

scraped_reviews.content: Excellent!! Definitely worth the price! Easy to personalize your workouts and make adjustments as needed. Bad knees? Switch out your exercise. Great for different fitness levels. Being currently out of shape, it's easy to step up the intensity as I get stronger. I also enjoy being able to see the total pounds that I lifted during any given workout.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're glad we can offer flexible settings to fit your needs, Sheila! ‚ò∫Ô∏èThank you so much for your outstanding review!

scraped_reviews.content: The workouts and planning are great. I love the ability to easily and quickly enter equipment. However on Android it's essentially a standalone app. It has a single integration to health connect. However all the other apps I use integrate perfectly with each other and none of them use health connect. Strava, Garmin and Trainer road can talk to each other and trainer road can react to other workouts, without this I'll drop Fitbit the second I find something close that integrates better.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review, Brendan! It's great to see you've enjoyed the workouts. I've documented your requests for these integrations so that they can be considered further for the future. We appreciate your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: Haven't used it for long yet, but my impressions so far, as someone who is just starting to take workouts seriously, are pretty good. They ask the important questions, but don't expect you to shell out a ton of money for extra features or gym equipment you don't own right from day one, even though I was expecting and willing to pay at least some small amount. Excited to see how it works once I can get started.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and for choosing us on your fitness journey! If you ever have any feedback for us, please reach out to us at feedback@fitbod.me - we‚Äôre all ears! ü¶ª

scraped_reviews.content: I like the app. Particularly the home gym where you can list your equipment. It doesn't seem to track my progress when I manually update my weights, as the same exercise the next week will go back down in weight even though I upped it in the previous workout. It froze up today and wouldn't let me start my workout, wouldn't let me log in to my account, etc... I had to uninstall and then reinstall to get it to work. For the cost this thing should run flawlessly. There are other apps cheaper...
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Zachary, we apologize for this frustrating experience. If you still need additional assistance with this, please contact us at reviews@fitbod.me so we can help you out.

scraped_reviews.content: I am new to lifting and this app has given me the confidence at the gym and the insight to know how much I should be lifting and the proper form at my fingertips. I really like it. It could use an option to switch between generated routines that are home based (or little/no equipment) to gym based. I wish there was an easier way to customize what you have access to. You can build your own routines so there is a work around. Overall a great app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're so glad the app has helped you build confidence in the gym with the generated workouts and exercise videos/instructions! You can set up two different Gym Profiles so that you have 1 for home and 1 for the gym, then you can quickly switch as needed üí™ Tap into the Gym Profile (upper left of workout tab) > Your Gym > tap "+" to add another.

scraped_reviews.content: 4/5 super great app! Suggestions though, the notes would actually be useful if they saved and stayed with the exercise. That's the whole point of leaving notes so you can see. Add more exercises and equipment like Pitt Shark, hack squats. When I edit a weight / reps mid set it edits the remaining sets, don't like that at all.L super annoying to retype them ALL of you e already programmed your sets. When opening a saved workout and select to keep same weights it still changes the reps, don't like
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review! Notes can be viewed if you go to History > Results. We take exercise requests here: fitbod.me/new-exercise-request & feature requests here: feedback.fitbod.me. You can choose the Maintain Sets, Reps & Weight option when loading your workout to avoid any changes - message us at support@fitbod.me if you have issues there!

scraped_reviews.content: My favorite workout app but I'll admit it can be pricey for what you get. I absolutely love that it gives me great recommendations and figuresout suggested weights for me. That being said, if I say I don't have equipment, it may still recommend a cardio bike for example. There will sometimes be repeat exercises listed with different names which can get frustrating. And there are also times when the images/videos don't match the description which can be confusing for those new to exercises.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're honored to be your favorite! For cardio, you'll want to go to your Gym Profile > Cardio Recommendations > deselect the options you don't want included. I've noted down your feedback around the duplicated exercises so we can discuss this further. For any issues with specific videos, you can let us know at support@fitbod.me when those come up!

scraped_reviews.content: So far, I'm giving this 3 stars. If it works well, I may increase the rating. But, so far, it seems very finicky. After putting in all of my information initially, it gave me a workout requiring equipment I said I don't have, for muscle groups I did not pick to work on. I had to go back through, and change it all again. Not a great first impression of your app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to share this with us, Toni! We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your experience overall, but we're sorry to hear that there was an issue. Please reach out to us at reviews@fitbod.me so we can address the problem and ensure that it doesn't happen again in the future.

scraped_reviews.content: This app has truly been life changing for me. I was never able to stick to a workout routine. This was mostly because I really didn't know what routine to do. When I found a routine I liked, I would repeat it until I got bored with it...and then quit altogether. I have been using fitbod consistently for almost 2 years now! I feel better and look the best I have in my life! Fitbod switches up your workout every day based on the criteria you input. It is completely customizable. Best app!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Your review made our day, Mike! We're so honored that you chose Fitbod and have allowed us to help you in building training consistency and feeling better! Thank you for your support and sharing your wins with us :)

scraped_reviews.content: I've tried a lot of workout apps, and so far this one is the best. I honestly really like this one. I've been working out for years. I have ADD and it has always been frustrating and overwhelming trying to put workouts together and ones that im happy with. This app, don't just give you one set way to work out and be like, "ok, here you go". If gives you many options to pick and choose from to taylor around what you are looking for, and also equipment that is available to you. GREAT app!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you, Marie! We really appreciate your review and are grateful to have you in the Fitbod family! (:

scraped_reviews.content: Whoa, this app works really well for me. It's the best of them I've used. Easy to switch exercises, you can choose body weight only, add cardio, a lot of options. I turned on the addition of warm up sets and turned off supersets (personal pref) and it's doing great. It tracked your weights and sets you up for progressive overload. I'm really enjoying this so far, nice job!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review, Steve! We are so glad that your enjoying Fitbod üòä

scraped_reviews.content: Fitbod has organised my workouts in a way I don't have to think about it too much. Once the goals are set, it is almost autopilot from that point on. Only minor changes regarding time, equipment, and workout options are needed as per user needs. As of today, I am going through my 3rd subscription, and I don't think I'll change it. Thanks for the efforts üëåüèº
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Rafo, we are so happy to hear that the Fitbod app has helped you reach your goals! üí™ We hope you have another great next workout!

scraped_reviews.content: Pretty good workout app. Few things I think could use work is the muscle group variations. Really like doing a PushPullLeg split but can't do that effectively through here when it recommends an unequal balance of muscle groups, ie legs only once a week. Also, some muscle groups never get recommended unless you go in and change it, ie traps, calves, forearms. Another thing that would be nice is more equipment for home gyms, like sandbags. Overall a good app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review, Ben! If you have any additional details or screenshots of this uneven balance of muscle groups that are being generated this would be very useful for our team. Please, contact us at reviews@fitbod.me for additional assistance. In the meantime, we will also report your exercise suggestion back to our product team.

scraped_reviews.content: I really like the app and saw some gains using the app. I wont give it less stars because the issues can be fixed or one can adjust on the app but that takes away from the time i already had to carve out of my day. I would like to see some of these things adjusted. I work out alone and some of the workouts require I have a workout partner. Also, some beginners workouts start at 30 lbs. No way i can start with that. Some of the weights suggestions are weird. i don't have a 7.5 lb. weight.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your rating and valuable feedback, Fabiola! Your input means a lot to our team, and we'll make sure to share it with Product. We're grateful for your time and contribution as we strive to enhance the fitness experience for all our users. If there‚Äôs anything else you‚Äôd like to share with us, please let us know at feedback@fitbod.me.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for 3 years now and love it. It's very user friendly and functional. I love that I can select specific equipment I have access to so no longer the days of a workout where I don't have half the equipment. I also really like the ability to select a step and select to do it more often, less often or never again. Update: I mentioned I'd like to be able to set gym profiles/locations and they let me know you can!!! I love this even more now. Thanks for the instructions!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your review, Misty! We're happy to see you find it user friendly and enjoy the custom settings. The good news is you can set up multiple Gym Profiles in your app for different locations! Check that out here: fitbod.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360006333853-Your-Gym-Profile#h_01FC6CP5P3V2GS0PD21WDGZT4B

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app. There are so many options if you are not able to do some exercises. I'm not able to do all their recommendations (I'm on the heavier side), so they give me the option to replace them for an easier but yet challenging exercise. Update.... I want to know if there is a change you guys can add, cardio kickboxing, or dance on the cardio section?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your 5-star rating! It‚Äôs an honor to be a part of your fitness journey. If you haven‚Äôt already, we‚Äôd totally recommend you join our online Fitbod Facebook Group with over 18K Fitbodders :) You‚Äôd love it! https://www.facebook.com/groups/fitbod

scraped_reviews.content: I'm enjoying the app and the variations on workouts. I wish it allowed for 2 things though. #1 - it would be awesome if I could save and "merge" workouts. Specifically when I have a shorter workout related to rehabbing an injury. Being able to track and add those in would be nice. #2 - some days I want a variation of workouts before picking one. Keeping a history of generated workouts would be an awesome value add.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to share your review and feedback, Jacob! I've documented your suggestions for our Product team to take a closer look. We hope you continue to enjoy the app and workouts :)

scraped_reviews.content: I've only used this app for two workouts so far and it's already better than any I've tried. Straight to the point. Simple interface. Good variety of exercises based on the equipment I own, and it seems to smartly choose exercises based on what I've recently worked out. Takes all the guesswork out of my home workout. However, there are no integrations on the android app like there are on iOS. I'm really missing Google Fit or Health Connect integration. 5 stars if Health Connect is added!

It's not a bad app, other than the complaints from others that the app doesn't seem to pair with other ecosystems, and the fact that it's apparently missing major features from its iOS version, I don't mind it. However, what I do mind is not being able to adjust the weight you can do for an exercise, I just started my fitness journey, I can't do 60lbs yet.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the review, Jorge! Parity between apps is something we've been working hard on, we've been gradually introducing more features to Android :) You should be able to adjust your weight by tapping the number for the weight field on any exercise. If you have any other feedback, you can send that over to us at feedback@fitbod.me!

title: Waze Navigation & Live Traffic
description:
Know what's ahead on the road with the help from other drivers. Waze is a live map that harnesses the local knowledge of tens of millions of drivers around the world. Drivers safely and confidently reach their everyday destinations thanks to Waze map‚Äôs GPS navigation, live traffic updates, real-time safety alerts (including roadworks, accidents, crashes, police, potholes and more), and accurate ETAs.

Make your next drive more predictable and stress-free:
‚Ä¢ Get there faster with real-time directions, accurate ETAs and automatic rerouting based on live traffic, incidents and road closures
‚Ä¢ Even if you know the way, avoid surprises on the road ahead with safety alerts for accidents, crashes, roadworks, objects on the road, potholes, speed bumps, sharp curves, bad weather, emergency vehicles, railway crossings and more
‚Ä¢ Steer clear of tickets by knowing where police and red light and speed cameras are located
‚Ä¢ Share what‚Äôs happening on the road with other drivers by reporting live incidents and hazards
‚Ä¢ Stay informed of upcoming speed limit changes, and keep your speedometer in check 
‚Ä¢ Know which lane to be in with multi-lane guidance 
‚Ä¢ See toll pricing and choose to avoid tolls along your routes
‚Ä¢ Add road passes and vignettes for HOV lanes and restricted traffic zones
‚Ä¢ Find petrol/fuel stations and prices and EV charging stations along your route
‚Ä¢ Locate and compare parking lots and their prices near your destination
‚Ä¢ Use voice-guided turn-by-turn navigation from a variety of languages, local accents and your favourite celebrities
‚Ä¢ Plan your next drive by checking ETAs by future departure or arrival times
‚Ä¢ Use your favourite audio apps (for podcasts, music, news, audiobooks) directly within Waze 
‚Ä¢ Sync Waze to your car‚Äôs built-in display through Android Auto

* Some features are not available in all countries

* Waze navigation is not intended for emergency or oversized vehicles

You can manage your in-app Waze privacy settings at any time. Learn more about the Waze privacy policy here, www.waze.com/legal/privacy.
