summary: Avoid delays. Get real-time GPS navigation, safety alerts and live traffic.

scraped_reviews.content: This is a great app but I have found some issues. I have been using this app for about 1 year and there are a couple features that definitely need improvement. The character voices are super quite. Even at full volume I can barely hear it over road noise. When I have BT music going. It basically cuts the music but is barely audible The auto navigation isn't great. I didn't find anything in the settings to change it. I would like to be able to pick a planned route before it starts navigating.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi David! This article might help with your issue: https://tinyurl.com/3urx2am9. In case you still need help, feel free to open a support ticket with this link: https://tinyurl.com/wdyfskxe and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Used to be really good when they had a detour button, now average. That detour button needs to come back, and they need to add a way to add a stop on a route. Also, it tends to be off by a few miles at first before I start the route. I bounce between this and Google maps, but if they brought those features in? I'd use it more frequently.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Hadassah! Thanks for reaching out. We appreciate you taking the time to give us a suggestion to improve the Waze experience. We'd like to invite you to add that to the Waze suggestion box: https://tinyurl.com/4auzrky3.

scraped_reviews.content: Strange bug. I was on the highway approaching an exit in about 3 miles when the directions changed; I thought I had somehow missed it when I realized... It just went to the next step. It was operating that I had already made the exit and just added the mileage together. Also, why must we press continue/resume so many times? If I check other routes or go to settings I *have to hit* those at least twice. Why?? That screen doesn't add any valuable information.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. We understand how that could be frustrating. We're here to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket at the following link, and someone from the team will get back to you soon: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: Since the latest update installed on 8/25, my phone (Samsung S24+) has been draining the battery much more than before while using Waze. I keep getting the warning message: "Waze is using system resources excessively and slowing down your phone. Put it in deep sleep to keep your phone running smoothly." I've never had any issues with Waze doing this previously, but something happened on this last update that is causing this. Even with my phone plugged in and charging, the battery goes down.

"Stay on top" doesn't work on any of our Galaxy phones. Also, every day, it tries to send me thru a path that takes longer to my destination (it verifies it because when I refuse to take that path, the time goes down) AND is more side roads. This has been happening for years on and off, but I'm surprised at how consistently it's been doing this with my new morning commute.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, MC. We're here to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket and someone from the team will get back to you soon. To start, click this link https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: adequate for urban navigation. Absolute garbage for rural. In the last two days, the Waze app changed directions twice without notifying me. In another instance I confirmed the destination and while on transit, the directions changed to a similarly spelled street in a different location. Worst of all, if Waze can't find it, it will not say so, but instead will assume a destination nearby. I depend on accuracy in directions for my job and this app has cost money. will never use again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Garrett! This article might help with your issue: https://tinyurl.com/3nhbkbym. In case you still need help, feel free to open a support ticket with this link: https://tinyurl.com/wdyfskxe and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: My biggest complaint, which is very frustrating, is the lack of picture in picture (PiP) feature on Samsung Galaxy. Between driving and passenger, being able to allow for Waze to float on my screen while looking for food, gas, etc (on road trips) is such an inconvenience. Which at times sends me to open Google maps as they do have that feature. Also, there are times I open up a pinned location and the GPS takes me to a completely different place. Inconsistent calibration.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Roshelle, thanks for reaching out. We appreciate you taking the time to give us a suggestion to improve the Waze experience. We'd like to invite you to add that in this link: https://tinyurl.com/52pcuh32. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: it's okay. I uninstalled it & went back to Google Maps after it kept ending my navigation for no reason while trying to navigate through downtown Austin TX; super frustrating and stressful. I like how you can report hazards. It needs some work for when you search for things like gas stations or restaurants while driving; instead of showing what's on your route, it shows what's around, even if it's way out of the way. It's a cute app and has lots of potential, and I'd love to come back!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Claudia. This article: https://tinyurl.com/3fbxhavu should help solve your concern. If you still need help, please open a support ticket through here https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz and someone from the team will get back to you soon. If I was able to help, it would be great if you could take a moment to update your rating.

scraped_reviews.content: I was using Google Maps but heard people rave about Waze, so decided to give it a chance. Well, some parts are better, and some not so much. I am able to make reports via Waze while driving whereas I couldn't with Google Maps. But, Waze falls short on things like: it doesn't automatically resume a drive if the phone becomes disconnected, it doesn't allow you to choose an alternate route with the tap of a finger on the map, and I have to tap multiple things to get it to start a new drive.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hey Lisa! Thank you for your feedback. We‚Äôre always looking to improve Waze, and user feedback is one of our most important tools for doing so. For future reference, you may visit this article: https://tinyurl.com/3nhbkbym for more information about alternate routes
.

scraped_reviews.content: Dark mode "only at night" doesn't work correctly nor does it properly sense night time on vehicles with automatic headlights. Update: Thanks for the response! Unfortunately, disconnecting and reconnecting while driving is not a safe or practical solution, nor is pulling over to fix what is fundamentally a software flaw. Waze seems to require regular disconnects to "fix" things and that doesn't seem to be getting better.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Nathan! This article might solve your dark mode issue: https://tinyurl.com/ycx2fajr. If you still need help, please open a support ticket and someone from the team will get back to you soon: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app!!!! It's the only directional app I use. Very accurate and precise real time! Tells you where police, construction, cars on shoulder or debris in road. Could use some more voices, just to switch it up a bit, but no complaints! It's too bad Robin Williams is past. He would have been a fun voice to drive along with!! Maybe with AI, it could be done.

used to be a good app. In the last couple months it can't seem to tell where I'm at (gps is horrible) and sends me on wild goose chases in the wrong direction. ive also gotten lost twice thanks to waze. The deal breaker for me is that you can no longer pick your "routes" as it only shows you one way and if you"re lucky 2. super annoying. i wanted to take the highway since its normally the fastest, no option for that at all. I'm on the app store now looking for a competent replacement.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Kristen! This article: https://tinyurl.com/eduwm5a7 and https://tinyurl.com/bjz5bzxc might answer your question. If you still need help, please open a support ticket, and someone from the team will get back to you soon: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: Edit, Waze is running again. Hopefully, it doesn't crash... After using Waze for years, the app has now crashed. I typed in and spoke the address I wanted to go to multiple times. Most of the time, Waze didn't respond, or if it did, it couldn't give directions. I un-installed and then reinstalled the app, and I can't log back into my account. I tried searching for the address I wanted to do and received a message that there wasn't a network signal. This app is now useless.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Carly! We sincerely apologize for any hassle that this has caused you. We're happy to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket, and someone from the team will get back to you soon. To start, click this link: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: This has never been a problem before, but WAZE now refuses to play through my phone's speaker, even though this option is set properly. If there is any Bluetooth connection through an earbud, headset, or your car, it will only play the directions through that device now unless you disable that Bluetooth. At first i thought it was my phone, but clearly, something happened with an update because I've talked to several people who regularly use WAZE and it's doing it to them, too. Please fix!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. We sincerely understand the sentiment and we kindly ask you to voice out your suggestion via this link https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz. Also, to set your sound preferene, you can follow this article https://tinyurl.com/4xme5k3h. For further assistance please contact us here: https://m.me/waze

scraped_reviews.content: It seems like things get worse with evey upgrade the past couple of years. Searches come up with results in various states when I'm looking for something in my immediate area. Also, if I search for a place/person saved in my favorites, then only the address and not their name will show up in the recent menu now. Who remembers addresses? That's pretty much like asking people to remember people's telephone numbers.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Deb. We understand where you're coming from. We're here to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket at the following link, and someone from the team will get back to you soon: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: App has become worthless. Getting directions through car radio has *never* worked because I have an Android phone. Developers must think everyone owns iPhones. Now I can't get directions through phone at a volume I can hear if Bluetooth is turned on. I'm can't turn off Bluetooth because then I can't get calls through car which is required in my state. Can't keep looking at app and the road. This becomes an accident waiting to happen. May as well delete app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Jo. We're happy to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket by copying this link: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz in a browser, and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: Switched from Google maps to Waze and I like it a lot better but there are still a few things that could be improved upon. 1. It would be nice to be able to Zoom out to at least the entire country (right now I can barely Zoom out over more than a few states) 2. The app won't open unless your location is on which is kinda annoying. 3. The ability to transfer saved placed from other map apps would be awesome. 4. The suggestion/feedback section doesn't work.

Language talk back doesn't work, you click on the speaker to hear an example, and all it does is select it, no audio. Speaking of audio, audio player doesn't work. Downloaded YouTube music and the option is there, doesn't open. Third, location isn't accurate and you can't adjust location on map (my bike is down the street from my home). The icons are cute and you can avoid unpaved roads, so that's a plus!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Victoria. This article: https://tinyurl.com/2ysahw4r should help solve your concern. If you still need help, please open a support ticket through here https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz and someone from the team will get back to you soon. If I was able to help, it would be great if you could take a moment to update your rating.

scraped_reviews.content: My go to nav app. However, now it constantly prompts me to allow for conversational chats while I'm driving. The only options are "Not now" and "Settings" so you can't just deny. Therefore the prompts keeps popping up. Please just ask once. Also, people shouldn't be having or even reading conversations while driving. One star taken away for this extremely annoying and unsafe feature.

This app is broken more than it works, especially with Android Auto. Right now, you cannot add an additional stop to your route. It no longer displays what you want on the screen and just says, "Okay, it's going there," but never reroutes and doesn't show the path on the road anymore. I've been using Waze for a long time and have been using it with Android Auto for a long time, but instead of getting better, this app just seems to get worse and worse and breaks with every other update.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Adam. We sincerely apologize for the hassle you've experienced while using the app. We're happy to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket, and someone from the team will get back to you soon. To start, click this link: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: This app has gone in the gutter. It used to let you set your route - through preferred safe areas. Now it may let you start your drive with that route, but as you progress, Waze changes the route - without notice - to go through crime ridden areas. Not a safe app to use! ETA, this is how the app is set to function per support chat. Unsafe.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi An. We're sorry to hear that you went through that. These articles, https://tinyurl.com/3nhbkbym, https://tinyurl.com/3d89knfd, and https://tinyurl.com/36mx3yn2, might help. If you still need help, please open a support ticket at the following link, and someone from the team will get back to you soon: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: Using it all the time but Waze is clearly in decline. :-( I don't see many Wazers on the map anymore. Had several occasions recently when Waze routed me through closed and restricted areas, which clearly have been closed for a while. Police alerts are the only useful aspect of the app. I wish there was a way to turn off "car on shoulder" alerts because they are happening all the time and lost their usefulness.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Alex, we understand your concerns. Road closures are added to the map after multiple user reports. If you find a closed road that isn't on the map, you can report it: https://tinyurl.com/pd7su7dx. Also, here's the guide to customize your alerts: https://tinyurl.com/mt3n6cuf. Still need help? Let us know here: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is great until it isn't. The biggest issue is in the case where there is multiple streets or roads with the same name and number, and it'll automatically choose one of them rather showing the specific details for each one. This is even more apparent on the carplay version of the app where it didn't even show the one I wanted to go to. It also has a terrible time picking up specific locations on command.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jalen. We're sorry to hear that you're running into this issue. We're here to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket at the following link, and someone from the team will get back to you soon: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: The most recent update will only allow the app to work through Android Auto. I've always had one map displayed through Android Auto and Waze displayed on my mounted phone while driving. Now when my phone is plugged in, Waze no longer displays a map, only step by step directions. If this isn't fixed I'll uninstall. The whole reason I liked Waze was because I could run it at the same time as other maps and compare routes/arrival times. If I can't do that anymore I'll delete the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Jessica. We're here to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket and someone from the team will get back to you soon. To start, click this link https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz. If I was able to help, it would be great if you could take a moment to update your rating.

scraped_reviews.content: Aural alerts are muted when the app is running in the background and you don't have an active route ("navigate to"). The main point of this app is to tell me what's up ahead. If I didn't want the alerts (why wouldn't I??) then I would just turn the volume down on my phone, right? (Right??) This bug has been in several updates over the last few years... can we finally get this fixed back to the way it used to work? EDIT: thanks for the reply, but I already had those settings...
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jim! This article might help with your issue: https://tinyurl.com/3urx2am9. In case you still need help, feel free to open a support ticket with this link: https://tinyurl.com/wdyfskxe and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I've had it for about a year and it WAS working great. But within the past 2 months or so, it has started telling me to turn left, or right, about a mile before I need to turn. It doesn't say, "In 1 mile turn..." It just says turn. I have made a wrong turn a few times because it says turn a mile and a half-mile before a need to. Seriously considering finding another app if this isn't fixed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Troy! This article might help with your issue: https://tinyurl.com/3urx2am9. In case you still need help, feel free to open a support ticket with this link: https://tinyurl.com/wdyfskxe and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Oct 2025 Update: now you have to dictate hazards other than police and traffic, this function does not work for me (Google voice works fine). There is no way for me to mark objects on road now, so this app has become useless to me. This app has become integral to my driving: it has notified me of objects and stopped vehicles on road, definitely saving me from at least 2 collisions. Don't go without it, even if you know where you're going.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jenny! This article might help with your issue: https://tinyurl.com/4ur8f875. In case you still need help, feel free to open a support ticket with this link: https://tinyurl.com/wdyfskxe and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: It used to be fine on my old Galaxy S20 FE but now that I've upgraded to Galaxy S25 FE any links don't open. The app starts but doesn't direct to the link address so I have to manually enter it. Same when I want to add a stop or change designation to an already started location. It also doesn't show the fastest or easiest route in case of side streets. I use it only because it shows police or hazards but I'd love it if they could fix the above.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Val! These articles: https://tinyurl.com/5dtjy6re and https://tinyurl.com/d5xjjsyh might answer your question. If you still need help, please open a support ticket, and someone from the team will get back to you soon: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using Waze for a while now and I loved it lately it just opens itself out of the blue for no reason it freezes up to the point where I can't even close it because it forces itself right back into the app. I have to restart my phone to get my phone to start working right again because this app is starting itself up whenever it has an urge to. that doesn't want to work when you really need it. but when it does work it's actually pretty good. I will review as issues are fixed
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Michael. We're here to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket and someone from the team will get back to you soon. To start, click this link https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: It's not uncommon for it to send you on routes with stop and go traffic. Even if you take your own detour because you know there's likely stop and go traffic, it may try to send you back into traffic. App also gives distance in time, which is useless in stop and go traffic (might as well give me distance in bananas while you're at it). Distance should be given in miles or kilometers.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Brandon! Thank you for your feedback. We‚Äôre always looking to improve Waze, and user feedback is one of our most important tools for doing so. For future reference, you may visit this article: https://tinyurl.com/2zuma7xd for more information about changing distance units.

scraped_reviews.content: Example of programmers, over programming. I mean, why have just one confirm button action, when you can have two! When your driving, you need more distractions so after its taking you a minute to find or type your destination, then selected to GO NOW, what you really wanna be doing rather than concentrate on the road ahead, is to click GO NOW for a second time, just incase youve changed your mind after taking the time (and eyes off the road) to search for it. clever stuff!

I've been having an issue with my Waze app lately. when I'm using the app the screen flashes between the map and a blank screen about every 2-3 seconds, It never did this before and it gets to be very aggravating and distracting especially at night. I prefer Waze over any other navigation app but if I can't resolve this issue then I'll have to find something else to use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Roger. We're happy to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket by copying this link: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz in a browser, and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: I really love this navigation app! Even if you don't have a pre planned route programmed in, it still works great! Waze notifies you of upcoming hazards like, vehicles on the side of the road, police, road construction, accidents, and more. The amazing thing is, it notifies you within a mile before you see them. I use Waze more than I use Google Maps! Waze is very reliable too. Another great thing about it is, it has a programmable speed alarm that alerts you that you're going too fast. üòÄ

Could be a great app if it would add the functions Google Maps had before they shut down the Service. No offline maps for when your in the middle of nowhere. If you don't know where you're at address wise, there's no option to use "your location". No way to categorize saved places to try to keep them separated from work and personal. Considering Google bought Waze, you'd think they'd integrate a lot of the functions that made the Google Maps Drive so popular.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Royce! Want to suggest a new feature for Waze? Feel free to submit your ideas directly to our suggestion box: https://tinyurl.com/4bm8e4nk. Check out these guides: https://tinyurl.com/abmwbd6a and https://tinyurl.com/pp5pj9 for future reference.

scraped_reviews.content: Cannot easily update speed limits and their changes. It's very simple. Need a speed limit adjustment option on the go. In the same way as reporting an obstacle etc, need the ability to report a speed limit change. Most of the roads are out of sync with the speed limits. Uninstalling. Will try again in a year and see if the tool is added. Right now this is too inaccurate to safely use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. We understand that this is important for you. We‚Äôre always looking to improve Waze, and user feedback is one of our most important tools for doing so. We invite you to add your suggestion to the Waze suggestion box: https://tinyurl.com/4bm8e4nk.

scraped_reviews.content: Waze is going downhill. Can't trust it anymore to give the shortest route. Perfect example: every 2 weeks I make an 80-mile drive. When I leave my house I look for the best route and most of the time the fastest and shortest route doesn't even show up. I now take this route and it always saves me 10-15 minutes. I am finding more and more roads where the speed limit that waze shows is wrong. I have tried repeatedly to report it but they don't have a way to report wrong speed limit.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi David! These articles might help with your issue: https://tinyurl.com/4fs5b7f8 and https://tinyurl.com/3nhbkbym. In case you still need help, feel free to open a support ticket with this link: https://tinyurl.com/wdyfskxe, and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I used to LOVE this app, but it's changed recently. When driving to your selected address, you used to be able to select routes and it would show you multiple options to your destination. It rarely does this now. In fact, it selects slower routes now. Case in point, I tried to have it look for a known faster route and it showed my current route as the only option. I'm now stuck in dead stop traffic at 1:50am, adding 45 min to my drive already. Very disappointed in whatever updates happened.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Joe! This article: https://tinyurl.com/3nhbkbym might solve your routing issue. If you still need help, please open a support ticket by copying this link: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz in a browser, and someone from the team will get back to you soon.

scraped_reviews.content: I love Waze! It's been my go-to GPS navigation for years. There are so many great features that come along with it, from the fun navigation voices you can choose from and the car icon you can pick, to (my personal favorite feature) the alerts for nearby cops and other set backs on the road that other Wazers can add to the map for all to see. It's just a really helpful and fun app, plus its completely free! I recommend it 100%!

I really loved this app until the recent update. Shows traffic alerts, great navigation, etc.. After this last update, it just does not work anymore. It calculates the route, so you start off, then randomly it tells you: something went wrong, can not calculate the route. Then it just shows where you are on the map. I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app, same issue. Very sad, I hope they fix it soon.

This used to be my go-to navigation app. The last couple of trips, it sent me super far out of the way for no reason. what should have been a 10-minute trip, waze wanted to send me on a 49-minute route. Even though they are owned by Google, maps is the one I use now, or map quest. also, they used to tell you about road closures, which doesn't seem to anymore. bye bye waze.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Alam! We sincerely apologize for the hassle you've experienced. This article: https://tinyurl.com/3c88fnha might answer your question. If this isn't the case, please open a support ticket, and someone from the team will get back to you soon: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz.

scraped_reviews.content: For the last week or so (since an update to the app) the screen in my vehicle no longer displays the alert (Ex: Police reported ahead) for me to say "yes" or "no". It verbally tells me it's there, but no way for me to say it is or isn't there. I've written to Waze and they want me to check my settings (done), and send a debug report - too time consuming and there has to be other people having the same issue. It's never just me when I have app issues. Please investigate.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Jen. This article: https://tinyurl.com/ybpf3z5f should help solve your concern. If you still need help, please open a support ticket through here https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz and someone from the team will get back to you soon. If I was able to help, it would be great if you could take a moment to update your rating.

scraped_reviews.content: Waze no longer places notifications about hazards over the box containing my ETA, time and distance remaining! I can finally see my trip status at all times! Yay!! Now the problem I have is not being post a hazard if one's already showing on the screen! So, if an accident is reported, I can't overlay with a post that a specific lane is blocked. If an object is on the road 0.3 miles before I can see that car on the shoulder, I can't report it. The ADD button is hidden. Make it make sense pls!!

Reporting Map issues does not work. if I try to report now after typing it in, cannot submit, submit botton stays light blue. If I hit Later, then when I tap on it, instead of opening, it dissappear. please fix. Also,during a traffic jam, the indicator of how long it might take to get thru is covered by the current speed and speed limit sign/indicator. Love lane closure feature addition.

It's been asked for, for a year or longer. ADD A FEATURE TO KEEP THE SPEED LIMIT DISPLAY ONLY. And it won't help your app any more if you don't have an easy way to report an incorrect destination flag for a store, restaurant, house ect.. Several address flags are off center, and it causes confusion in the directions, and could throw off those who don't recognize the mistake. Fix this app, and maybe, just maybe it'll take over for Google Maps
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Brendan! Thank you for your feedback. We‚Äôre always looking to improve Waze, and user feedback is one of our most important tools for doing so. For future reference, you may visit this article: https://tinyurl.com/eutw4hms for more information about speed limit alerts.

scraped_reviews.content: I would like to know why when I have the phone connected to my 2023 Tacoma via Bluetooth that the voice from the app isn't heard? If I disconnect it from the vehicle by turning off Bluetooth, the voice directions, warnings, etc. come back. Ok, I went in and turned off the "Play Sound to Speaker" as you recommened in the article but, still no notifications when I'm connected to the vehicle with Bluetooth. I guess I'll just have to accept that this App doesn't work for Android using Bluetooth.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there! This article: https://tinyurl.com/5ys4bsea might solve your Bluetooth issue. If you still need help, please open a support ticket by copying this link: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz in a browser, and someone from the team will get back to you soon.

scraped_reviews.content: It's good. No easy way to just add a favorite location. I like how the posted speed limit is on the screen next to your actual speed. Large text is great for android auto, but the Map icons and map text are too tiny, even on my giant screen. No means or ways to save current location to favorites with android head unit in automobile. Press and hold does nothing. It would be nice to have the voice tell you directions when you touch the top left directions box, like Megellan GPS maps do.

When the app works as intended, it's great! Notifies for police, construction, debris in the road and many other things. Love the customizable icons and voices. Where the problem lies is in android auto use. When I use Google assistant to tell waze to navigate somewhere, it will take multiple attempts before the app appears to attempt to direct. And more often than not, if I ask it to navigate to a common store, the top suggested location will be 50+ miles away although the same chain is nearby.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Andrew. We're happy to help, but we need a bit more information. Please open a support ticket by copying this link: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz in a browser, and someone from the team will get back to you soon. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: We used to enjoy Waze when it was first released. We would even recommend it to others. Now, the quick rerouting of the app takes us off the route we selected. Put in the option to say NO to the reroute. I want to stay on the route I selected. Hopefully, someone else comes out with a good app like Waze used to be. Maybe one they won't keep updating to make it worse.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ralph. We're sorry to hear that you experienced that. We would like to look into your report further, but we need more info. Please visit this link: https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz to open a support ticket, and someone from the team will get back to you soon.

scraped_reviews.content: I like this app but a feature that would be extremely helpful is "Detour" and the ability to say for how long (i.e. in miles or roads, etc.). My Garmin GPS had that feature and it was helpful when there was a problem with the route I was on and it was easier to select than looking at alternate routes which ultimately get you back on a road you're avoiding!

I've been using Waze mostly since 2017 and unfortunately after Google bought them Waze has gone downhill. Traffic issues report a lot slower and sometimes not at all. Plus if there is a traffic issue it seems more often than not Waze does not give you an alternate route. Another thing to note is that it seemed like it would pickup on your regular route and present that to you first, but now it will give you the "most efficient" route regardless of traffic. This is not always the best option.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Mike. This article: https://tinyurl.com/y7es9nj6 should help solve your concern. If I was able to help, it would be great if you could take a moment to update your rating. If you still need help, please open a support ticket through here https://tinyurl.com/mrx77ukz and someone from the team will get back to you soon.

title: Photoshop Express Photo Editor
description:
PHOTO EDITING MADE FUN AND EASY

Tap into your creativity with a photo editor made for fun, fast, and easy one-tap photo edits. Trusted by millions, Photoshop Express is the picture editor perfect for turning creative ideas into reality. Add text to photos, touch up a selfie, make pre-post edits, and apply vibrant or vintage camera filters. With Photoshop Express, you get a state-of-the-art AI image generator, easy-to-use collage maker, and a face editor app.

Get a photo editor app with airbrush tools, a collage maker, and vintage camera filters to fit any aesthetic. From film effects and text overlays to photo stickers and retouch tools ‚Äì get thousands of ways to customize and edit photos.

Airbrush your selfie in just a few taps with our face editor app! Clean up images with red eye corrector, healing, clone stamp, and blemish remover features. Choose from hundreds of camera filters for moody film effects, aesthetic styles, or one that feels like a vintage camera! Collage maker, AI photo generator, and face editor app ‚Äî get it all with Photoshop Express.

Enjoy a high-quality image editor no matter your photography skills. Get Photoshop Express today for a comprehensive yet simple way to edit and retouch photos and transform moments!

PHOTOSHOP EXPRESS FEATURES

AI PHOTO EDITOR & IMAGE RETOUCH
- Airbrush your selfie with our face editor app
- Vintage camera filters give your photo a retro touch
- Add text to photos to elevate your images
- Face editor app that allows you to retouch and enhance photos with blemish remover and spot healing tools
- Replace image backgrounds, remove objects, and add filters that feel like a vintage camera
- Remove blur, dehaze pictures, erase background noise, and easily apply presets
- Use AI photo tools to erase objects, add makeup, and restyle images

ADD TEXT TO PHOTOS & USE OUR COLLAGE MAKER
- Combine pictures in a pre-made photo grid with our fun and simple photo collage maker
- Add text to photos and create memes with easy-to-use graphic design features
- Create custom stamps and watermarks with dozens of fonts and layouts to choose from

LEVEL UP YOUR CREATIVITY WHEN YOU USE TEXT TO IMAGE
- Photoshop Express is more than a face editor app. Use our AI photo generator to expand the possibilities of creative concepting
- Create custom eye-catching stickers or try on an outfit or accessory you create with a text prompt
- Level up your vision and moodboards with distinct imagery provided by our AI image generator
- Add your own reference image to your prompt to generate photos that align with your aesthetic

UPLOAD & SHARE PHOTOS EASILY
- Upload images from multiple source formats (including RAW, TIFF, and PNG)
- Face editor app, collage maker, and image editor that‚Äôs perfect for social media
- Share photos to your favorite social channels like Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, Snapchat, Facebook, Line, and Telegram

Unlock unlimited possibilities with Photoshop Express Premium!

PREMIUM
Upgrade to Photoshop Express Premium to access extra, exclusive features, and more precise editing controls.

Photoshop Express is the picture editor made for everyone. Make photo magic happen with Adobe Photoshop Express. Fix photos, create fun memes, and make personalized pic collages today!

Adobe Terms of Use:
Your use of this application is governed by the Adobe General Terms of Use http://www.adobe.com/go/terms_en and the Adobe Privacy Policy http://www.adobe.com/go/privacy_policy_en
Do not sell or share my personal information www.adobe.com/go/ca-rights

Photoshop Express is the picture editor made for everyone. Make photo magic happen with Adobe Photoshop Express. Fix photos, create fun memes, and make personalized pic collages today!

Adobe Terms of Use:
Your use of this application is governed by the Adobe General Terms of Use http://www.adobe.com/go/terms_en and the Adobe Privacy Policy http://www.adobe.com/go/privacy_policy_en
Do not sell or share my personal information www.adobe.com/go/ca-rights
summary: Enhance, retouch & create your story - Share the moment with Photoshop Express.

scraped_reviews.content: Photoshop Mix used to be my main photo editing tool, that is, until it was discontinued without the ability to access the app at all, so you'd be forced to transition to this one. I can't access any of my old projects, and I don't feel safe using this one, knowing that I could lose all my projects if this one also gets discontinued at some point. Plus, it doesn't have the functionality of Mix even with premium it appears, no layer capability, and most features are locked behind a paywall.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, we apologize for any frustration caused by the transition from Photoshop Mix to Photoshop Express. We are working on bringing complete Mix features to our Android app. Some features are already available. The full Mix capability is on iOS, and we aim to achieve feature parity across platforms soon. ^Sam

scraped_reviews.content: While trying to crop an image, the interface didn't make it clear how to complete the crop, other than just to save the image. That simply ignores easily predictable user needs, which good apps never do. Then it took me to a screen in which it forced me to either share the app, or close it! Well, if you FORCE users to sell your app for you, then you're asking for a one star rating. Your request is granted.

Great, but don't use save button, otherwise you can't post it. They have made some sort of update that provides a message upon using the 'save' option that says 'watermark applied'. It isn't a visible watermark, just a Metadata watermark that prevents apps such as Instagram from allowing you to post it. Otherwise, it's amazing. There are plenty of great things to use from the free version. I dropped down from 5 for 2 stars because of this. But it is an easy enough to fix - screenshot and crop.

Leaving this review so the app will stop telling me to. It's good for what it is. It's fairly limited, only letting you make small adjustments to images and compile collages, but if that's what you need, this app will get the job done. Color shifting is easy, you can add text, there's options to export to different apps... All decent stuff, if formatted a bit strangely. If you're looking for something on the same level as the desktop version of Photoshop, though, just use the desktop version.

I like the program! it's been helpful üòå. however, I'm super limited on what ai can do. I feel they should allow you to use all features for FREE for a limited time. I'm not sure if it's worth paying a monthly or annual subscription ü§î bc I'm not able to access those features. The features I'm able to use, takes a lot of work for the results I'm expecting. I find it difficult when trimming photos and clearing items out the background.

Photoshop Express is genuinely awful to use in every category imaginable if you choose to use their free version. It's far more limited than any default photo editor that comes pre-installed on your phone. It also constantly pesters you about their premium service, not once allowing you to take any action without an annoyingly placed pop-up. The free app only serves to waste your precious time and phone memory.

The "Upgrade to Premium" bottom banner makes me unreasonably agitated with how it appears on every new screen you navigate to, making you accidentally click on the wrong thing constantly. The push for AI is also really gross. It's still "the industry standard" for photo editing, but it's very cumbersome to navigate. Could be so much better, but everything other than basic is now locked behind a paywall, and I refuse to pay a subscription for it. Useful for basic mobile photo editing, I guess. ü´†

Different from using it on a phone from a Tablet. It does not have the same options whe I use it on my tablet. I cannot find the options in Adjustments to edit the subject or background. Very disappointing! It should be the same! It makes editing my pictures much more difficult when it should be easier on a larger screen!

This is not close to as good as desktop Photoshop. Im only using the free version but its so bad I am reluctant to pay for anything. Sliders are hard to select, standard tools and features are not available. I can't even change a background. Glad I have access to my desktop version of CS3 still. Nothing is as good today as it used to be.

You can add frames, apply filters, crop, adjust contrast, etc... BUT You cannot draw on the picture, cannot select color similarity to do a touch up, cannot use a drawing tool to correct pimples or other imperfections that we want to fix on a picture... so I gave it a 1 star because Photoshop is supposed to allow you to do all that!! this "Photoshop" app is very incomplete and idk why they don't have those features as an "in app purchase"

This app is nearly useless, and calling it "Photoshop" makes that brand name nearly meaningless. Not once has it been able to perform any of the relatively simple edits I've wanted to do, such as blur only a section of an image (*not* everything *except* a section). It doesn't have layers (their site claims it does, but the instructions don't work), it doesn't have selections, it doesn't have anything that makes Photoshop Photoshop. Even Lightroom is more powerful than this.

For a major brand name product like Photoshop, I am very disappointed. There's no searchable option for font types. The UI is clunky and unintuitive. Worst of all, the AI edit feature doesn't work. It asks me to paint the part of the image I want to change and describe the object to be painted in. However, all I ever get is an error message that the request could not be generated. Waste of time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! That shouldn't be happening! Can you please share a screen recording of the workflow with our community of experts (adobe.ly/photoshopexpresscommunity) for better assistance? We would love to investigate what's not working for you and help resolve the issues. Thanks! ^Sam

scraped_reviews.content: I love all the options, not all of them are free, but there's a lot more free selections than any other apps I've used like this, & there's also no ads at all. The only complaint I have is when making a collage, trying to zoom without rotating is irritatingly difficult af. There should be an option to fit/fill the pic to the frame like other apps have, if there was one I couldn't find it. Also not having the blue frame around ur selection in collage mode. It blocks the background.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, that would make a great feature request. Please click "Help and Feedback" from the mobile application and email us the request. Our development team monitors the email and may update it for future releases. ^Sam

scraped_reviews.content: It saddens me to give photoshop express such a low rating, since I have loved it for so long, used it for years on my photos! but after this recent update i now have to pay to use edits that were once completely free. Not only do i have to pay at all, but *monthly*. That is absolutely ridiculous. Adobe is successful enough not to need to raise rates on one of the few free apps they have. I'm really disappointed. üòû

What a waist of time from Adobe. I don't understand why they couldn't do something better than this. I don't see a single setting that is worth using it. Every setting they have ruins the image. There are many apps that will so a better job. I been using Adobe photoshop for tons of years. I always thought was the best program ever created for Photo editing. Is the most expensive program in the market but is worth every single penny. But when it comes to making mobile apps, just forget it!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Cesar! I am sorry that you feel such a way about the app. Could you please provide more information about your dissatisfaction with the app so we can work on it and improve it for you? We value your feedback and any suggestions you have to help us make the app better. Thank you! ^DC

scraped_reviews.content: Definitely not enough features. Very limited even the paid version. Phones now adays have all the basic stuff this has and you have to pay for it. It's like they split it up between photoshop and light room to get you to buy both. Won't re subscribe. All the features are basic. Who needs themes and stickers and draw on a photo editing app. This is for kids not the serious photographer looking to edit on mobile. Very disappointed. 100 a year for this is laughable. You can get the PC version4 that

Works wonderfully when it decides to (as in it barely works unfortunately). As I am trying to edit an engagement shoot, it continues to just randomly crash during edits. Half the time it can recover the image, half the time it can't. Along with this, after I finish my image and go to the save page, it will not save my image through the gallery or through my files. I lose all of my progress. However, when I can save it, the image looks great and the editing options are wonderful and simple to use. Hopefully they can fix the crashing and saving situation soon!

It's great and very professional! has every tool you need! The only thing that bugs me is how you can only open one photo at a time and can only select one. If you could integrate a next or previous button to see the other photos so that I could compare and move on quickly that would be amazing!! Also the app will sometimes crash and not allow me to open up projects or photos. If you could make this more reliable then that woud also be gret! Thanks!!

App Experience changed. No good now. On my old phone the app worked great. Now it is so riddled with prompts to upgrade to premium that I cannot use it. I get it. They want me to pay for it. 8 would if it was a one time fee, but I'm not paying on a subscription basis either monthly or yearly. Not sure what version I had prior to changing phones. Maybe I paid years ago and forgot? Either way, not paying now and not usable. I can do same stuff with the free software. Just liked the interface.

Great app, I love all the options and filters. I do wish it had some more advanced tools, especially in the selection, refining and color but and adaptation. It would be awesome to drop color in finite areas instead of applying to the entire selection. Also, needs a more fine control on the selection tools, it's too broad. That being said, the average user playing around with photos would find it wonderfully encompassing and very easy and fun to use!

I've used this app for years & I will say I have loved it & told everyone about it for 8yrs+. I just purchased a new device. I noticed the icon was different but I figured no big deal. WRONG. Some of the "corrections" are no longer free. I've pulled old images off various locations. Sometimes it's old with distortions. I could fix it easily. Not anymore. The 2 options are NOW unavailable unless you pay & I won't go into detail why that's not an option for me. You've lost a long-term customer.

I've used this free photo editor for years. It was balky, but it did create pretty nice pictures. All of a sudden, standard adjustments are listed as "premium,"as in I'll have to pay for what was formerly free, and on top of that, my photos now have a prominent "Photoshop Express" watermark on them, completely ruining them for printing. App deleted! I would have given it 3 to 4 stars in the past; I'd give it zero stars now, if I could!

This app is wonderful and so user friendly to even those who know nothing about photoshop. Not only can you find an editing tool for almost any aspect of photoshop (including a vast array of font styles and colors, filters, collage options, resizing tools, color correction, and more), but these options are clear, accessible, organized, and efficient. It works on mobile devices and computers like a charm. I've used this app for so long an couldn't think of anything better to use!

I love this app, it edits great, quality comes out just fine, resolution is good. The only problem I have is that it takes FOREVER to load on different edits. And it's not because of my device, its the app. I've tried everything, from deleting things on for space, to going from wifi to data, restarting my device, deleting and redownloading the app, and still it is slow on loading. Day after day, I have to wait forever for it to load for anything. Super annoying.

This app is excellent for quick and simple photo editing on your mobile device. I am a photographer as a hobby and editing this easily is so convenient. One small complaint I would give is that the effects tab to add effects mostly look kind of corny, and it's hard to masks them flow with the look of the photo as desired. If any adobe developer sees this, I would techies making it so that we can rotate, trim, and expand different elements of the effects so that it's less constricting to utilise. Overall an excellent choice for photo editing.

I loved the app & save had it for years! It was easy to learn & I could do the most amazing edits & restorations with it! Today, however, I tried to make a few edits & it was wouldn't save my work unless I started paying for it yearly/monthly. I would pay $20 or $25 to get this app, but I'm not paying money every month to use it! That's ridiculous! You people make more than enough selling your full versions! I am so disappointed! I won't be using it again. It will be uninstalled shortly.

This app is okay. It's a good way to get in a quick watermark and edits without using the desktop application. It definitely isn't a standalone, does-it-all sort of app, which is fine to me (it's free so). I do wish that you could erase parts of the effects. Some of the bokeh effects are beautiful but look odd when you can't erase part of it over the subject.

I have not used this app as much as I would like, but so far I think it is wonderful. I love the collage feature. I really like the more advanced editing and color contrast I can get with Photoshop Express. I like the different color themes and color contrast options. I also like that it lets you size it for various media options - posters, postcards, Instagram, etc. I am still learning about using text and sticker options.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Cynthia White, Thank you for sharing your thoughts! It's great to hear you're enjoying the collage feature and exploring the advanced editing options. We appreciate your enthusiasm and hope you continue to discover all the creative possibilities! ^Sam

scraped_reviews.content: Sad looking app. I don't know how it rates this high. I remember when this app had more options, now most are removed or paid only. I am glad I can still use my old computer to edit with creative suite. I will never pay for cloud based apps that are yearly subscriptions. So long Adobe, I have moved on and back. If it isn't physical, you don't really own it. I don't care what anyone thinks, virtual sucks.

If I could give this app zero stars I would. I signed up for a monthly subscription thinking it would be $20.99 per month but No!! Turns out it means it is that price for an entire year charged monthly. So not only did I get roped into this contract with these annoying people, I have to continue paying them even though I literally NEVER use this app. If I try to cancel I will be charged a cancellation fee. But I had no idea it was a yearly membership!! Don't get this app!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there! Please check out this helpful link here: https://support.google.com/googleplay/answer/2479637?hl=en. If this does not do the trick, please reach out to our customer service for further help (https://helpx.adobe.com/in/contact.html). Thanks! ^Chan

scraped_reviews.content: I had this app on a previous phone I got in 2018 and when I got a new phone this year, I of course, got this app again. I'm disappointed to find that all of the features that use to be free are now pay options. Entire rows of "looks" are now pay and it has ads. I figured your money would come from the ads. If you added new things and charged for them, that would be one thing but just charging for features that used to be free doesn't make me want to pay up. and now a watermark?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! I am sorry that you feel disappointed with the app. Few features (premium) are paid because that provides us the resources to provide you with the new, updated, and amazing software. While advanced features may require a subscription, we still offer a range of free features for users to enjoy. The feedback for ads is duly noted. ^DC

scraped_reviews.content: It's mini-photoshop- it should be a great tool. But what good is it if it crashes out of the blue without saving changes? Thirty minutes spent perfecting a photo and all of my progress, gone. Another twenty minutes spent on a different photo, same story. No one with a head on their shoulders would pay for this app. It's not worth the monetary investment considering how much time and effort will be stolen from you.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're so sorry for the trouble. Is the app crashing on a certain action? Are you getting any error messages? Please write to us at PSX-Feedback-Android@adobe.com with more details or a screen recording, it will be very helpful for us to investigate and fix the issue. We're here to help. Thank you! ^Chan

scraped_reviews.content: First day using it, but so far it is very easy to use, has so many filter options to chose from. Will only edit with PS from this day forward. I didnt think I would like the watermark feature as much as I do. I wish I could put my personal watermark in, or even move and adjust watermark provided. Maybe there is a way? But still learning, creating amazing photos and having fun in process. 1 year later... still loving it!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for your positive review! We truly appreciate your feedback and are thrilled to hear that you are enjoying our app. üòÉ üëç ^DC

scraped_reviews.content: There are probably a bunch of other apps that people use on Android to edit, make collages etc with their content. I go with what I know and that isn't some sort of malware app. So I go with this product from Adobe maybe bare bones if you have free standard trial but it's straight forward and doesn't take up much space. It can handle the basics if you need more robust then you have option to upgrade.

Downloaded with the intention of purchasing the full version of the app. They want an annual fee every year or a monthly fee. They can stick that where the sun don't shine. I have no problem paying for my software, but I'm not paying you every year or every month for the same software. I'll buy a photo editor program from a company that has a little couthe, instead of greedy little misers.

I pay monthly to use the Adobe complete works on my phone, tablet, and computer. It's got pretty much all I need! Especially Photoshop. However, there's a few tools missing from the mobile version from the computer version, like the more precise cut and fill tools for getting rid of backgrounds. There's also a lack of overlays, but other than that, it's all I need for most projects!

Typically my favorite photo editing app, always a go-to. Lately though, I've not been able to save projects, even after reinstalling the app, reopening it, and doing the work over. I've gone as far as deleting stuff from my phone incase it had something to do with data storage; nothing. I love PSE overall, don't get me wrong. But when it decides not to work, it really crashes and burns.

I really love this app. I am a professional fine artist does almost everything I need To adjust my landscape photos the way I want them. The only thing that might improve it is if there way to control each color of the Color wheel For paint pigments meaning red, Orange, Yellow, green, blue And Violet. If that is not possible it would be good if there was a separate control for each color in the visible light spectrum.

Been using this app for years to edit photos and it was perfect for finding filters, removing blemishes, etc. Yesterday I went to edit a photo only to find that everything is now behind a pay wall. As if they don't make enough money, they had to take away something from the poor people to make a handful of old white guys even more money than they already make. Typical app, starts great, people in company see how well it's doing and can't help but make you pay for things that were free at launch.

This app could have been ok for basic photo editing, but if you want to use it to combine two or more photos in a collage, it automatically selects a zoom level for each photo and you can't zoom back out, realistically. You can zoom in while rotating easily but somehow this is the only app I have ever had the (dis)pleasure to use that interprets pinching as zooming in and rotating. And who thought having "rotate with two fingers" and "pinch to zoom" active simultaneously was a good idea?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jason! We apologize for any inconvenience caused. Our team is dedicated to continuously enhancing the app's features and functionality. Your feedback has been duly noted and will be forwarded to our developers. We value your feedback and any suggestions you have to help us make the app better. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. ^DC

scraped_reviews.content: Maybe it's just me but this app is way harder to use than it should be. I spent 15 minutes trying to blur a license plate on my vehicle and still couldn't figure it out. Sometime Adobe products are just too complicated for their own good. I thought the Express app would be easy l, and, ya know, express...but alas, still too complicated.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: üë©‚ÄçüíªHey! We‚Äôve put together some handy guides you might be interested in: [http://adobe.ly/psxfaq & https://helpx.adobe.com/photoshop/using/photoshop-express-help.html] If you need help, shoot us an email at PSX-Feedback-Android@adobe.com. Let us know what we can improve to create a better experience for you. We're here to assist! ^Chan

scraped_reviews.content: It's definitely what it says it is, it's a light weight, mobile friendly version of photoshop. It's definitely targeted more towards photography enhancements than anything else though, so don't expect it to let you do all of the things its desktop big brother is capable. It does have a lot of neat filters that I wish were available out of the box with the full version though and the UI is much more intuitive for new users. My only big gripe is that it doesnt seem to let you delete photos.

Unbelievably worthless. You are limited to pre-made edit options, you can't add shapes or boxes, you can't draw on anything, there are zero options for personal touches. Pure garbage. EDIT: it is so useless that all I wanted was to black out the face of a child on a photo, and there is no possible way to add a box or anything to cover up something. No ability to draw, nothing. It is less than worthless. Because it is a waste of everyone's time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. If you'd like to suggest features and improvements to the app, please write to us at PSX-Feedback-Android@adobe.com, it will be very helpful for us to provide an even better experience in the future. Your feedback is very important to us.^Chan

scraped_reviews.content: Well, overall it's a great photo editing app. Love that I can watermark photos and save photo editing settings. My BIGGEST complaint is that once you finish with and save a photo there is no done button to just go back to the start for the next photo, if you need to go to the next photo to edit you have to back through everything and it prompts you to save when you try. Adds a ton more steps and is really frustrating.

Works pretty well, but refresh button and undo/redo arrows are inside image and block work in those areas. Also can't turn phone sideways to get larger landscape view, so max image size is about 2.8x1.5 inches. Edit: I just dropped it from 4 stars to 3 because they put even more clutter inside the frame ("refresh") so you can't edit where all the junk is blocking the image. Also, it is even difficult to find the image in the first place for editing
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, that would make a great feature request. Please click "Help and Feedback" from the mobile application and email us the request. Our development team monitors the email and may update it for future releases. ^Sam

scraped_reviews.content: Ps has once again surpassed all others!! Adobe always sets the bar high, and this app is no different. A better choice for professionals, or photo enthusiasts, or just someone looking to make their pictures more clear to print or post quality photos. There are many filter options accessible for free, the paid subscriptions have even more. The functions are easy to navigate and use. without a doubt the best picture editing app I've used in a while.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for your positive review! We truly appreciate your feedback and are thrilled to hear that you are enjoying our app. üòÉ üëç ^DC

scraped_reviews.content: All I wanted to do was give an image a transparent background without having to go from my computer back to my phone. I assumed in the Photoshop app that would be possible - but you can only save as JPEG. Also, it kept advertising a free trial for the full version, when I logged in with my Adobe ID. Does $60/a month REALLY not give me access to a Photoshop mobile app beyond features I can find on my phone's built-in image editor? Seriously??

I am a bit if a perfectionist when it comes to my photos, especially if I'm going to share them with someone, and always take a few minutes to correct for exposure/contrast/color balance before I send them. Normally I find that Google Photos' built in editor is sufficient, but occasionally I feel that it falls a little bit short. I have used Photoshop Express for years to fill in the gap, and it usually does what I need it to. My only complaint is that the interface is a bit of a pain.

Useless and only directs you here if you say you're going to give it a 5 star rating. If you do 4.5 or lower in the app, it opens an email to Adobe. That's right - they're artificially inflating the reviews on Google Play! It's seriously useless. They constantly pester you to upgrade. If you don't you can't really do anything - can't even edit your photo. Don't bother with this greedy company! Sad!

I requested this a little while ago, but hadn't used it yet. It seemed to move in last night, and It was pretty neat how I was brought into it. I photographed a bunch of shots with the phone camera and when I went to crop and adjust in the phone setting, all my photos were pixalated in a very low number dpi, and wouldn't load up. Dat-da-da-Daaaa! Photoshop Express to the rescue! I could do everything that I wanted to do plus a bunch more that I hadn't expected! This is all I'm allowed to say.497

title: MSN
description:
The MSN app keeps you informed, productive, and entertained with tailored content, real-time weather, stock tracking, short videos and more.‚Äã
‚Äã
Key features‚Äã

Your tailored feed, with you on the go.
Quality content from thousands of trusted publishers.‚Äã‚Äã

Weather report‚Äã
Get hourly and 10-day forecasts, air quality, UV index and more.‚Äã

Financial news‚Äã hub‚Äã

Your personalized video feed‚Äã‚Äã
