summary: The easy way to learn guitar! Play with interactive lessons, songs, tuner & more

scraped_reviews.content: For the first section that was available, I think it was pretty beginner friendly. There's a daily tracker to remind you to practice, but I don't feel like it's overly pushy. That's about as far as I got, however, because the sections following all seem to require making a subscription payment. I'm just starting out, why would I give money to something that I haven't even used for a week? I understand there's probably a lot of licensing and legal stuff, but it's still unfortunate.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback about the beginner-friendly features and daily tracker. It's understandable to feel hesitant about subscription costs so early in your journey. Your insights are important to us, and we hope you continue exploring the app's offerings. Thank you for sharing your thoughts!

scraped_reviews.content: Another app that tricks you into downloading it without telling you is a subscription based app. It hides the $135 subscription fee after your 7 day free trial by including it in the "in app purchases". In app purchases is generally considered to be extras. Like gold in a game, it armor for your pet whatever. Not the monthly or annual subscription fee! That's should be address by itself, not lumped in with all the various random charges that can be applied.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback regarding the subscription transparency. It's important for us to ensure clarity around costs, and we value your insights on this matter. Your perspective helps us understand user expectations better, and we‚Äôre grateful for your input.

scraped_reviews.content: Was my favorite app because I was able to to learn with the free option with 15 minutes a day limit; I had no problem. I also loved no ads. It was great to follow a step by step for beginners. I wasn't consistent due to responsibilities and school. But now restrictions on free option to force to pay membership it disappointing. I don't want to ask my parents for money with all the bills they still have to pay and save money. I'll be looking for another way to learn. It was nice while it lasted.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate you sharing your experience with the free option and the structured learning it provided. It‚Äôs understandable to feel disappointed with the recent changes, especially with your current responsibilities. Your feedback is important, and we hope you find an enjoyable way to continue your musical journey.

scraped_reviews.content: so this app was amazing back in the day but now it's just pushing you to subscribe. used to play the guitar and just needed something to get the muscles back in shape. if you are a complete beginner sure pick up the app. but after the basic intro you won't get far as it will demand you pay to move further. my best advice is to just use the tuning feature if you don't have one irl and switch to youtube. there are numerous channels that are dedicated to getting you started with chords anol
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback and understand your concerns about the subscription model and accessibility. It's great to hear you enjoyed the app in the past! We value your insights and hope you find the resources you need to continue your musical journey. Thank you for sharing your thoughts!

scraped_reviews.content: Used this app in the past for free a few years ago. It was fine then, except sometimes it didn't read my notes all of the time, you only got about a half hour or less of lessons a day, and the exercises felt like guitar hero but with generic songs. Took a break from it for a while because of those reasons and I instead tried learning real songs using free tabs online. Decided to come back to the app and now the free option is gone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback and understand your disappointment with the changes to the free option and the previous limitations you experienced. It's great to hear you tried learning through tabs! Your insights are valuable as we continue to improve the app. Thank you for sharing your thoughts!

scraped_reviews.content: I'm a beginner and so far the lessons themselves are pretty helpful, but the constant ads are so god damn annoying. Literally every 2 minutes I get them. Fine, whatever, I'd usually just brush them off, especially in mobile apps, but they pop up WHILE I'm practicing and then I just have to start the lesson I'm on all over again. I often don't care enough to write reviews, but this pissed me off to the point where I nearly snapped my strings in rage. Download if you want to break your guitar.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Please email us at help@yousician.com so we can investigate the issue and help you figure out what's wrong. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Now I know why the subscription is so expensive. The amount of ads they buy to sell this app. I have seen so many Yousician ads after installing this. I do like the way they visualize the strings and notes to play. The app listening to you play I don't like. It isn't clear how or if you can stop the listening "feature" of the app. I think the song variety is garbage, it is trailered to people wanting to learn pop music. Probably what the majority of people want, just not me. This for beginners.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback and understand your concerns about the ads and song variety. It's great to hear you enjoy the visualization of strings and notes! Regarding the listening feature, we recognize the need for clarity on how to manage it. Your thoughts are invaluable as we strive to improve the experience for everyone.

scraped_reviews.content: This was cool at first. But now it is boring. The "daily session" is lame... The tuner is cool, the warm up is cool... and then... nothing. There needs to be more guidance at that point. Song suggestions that fit with what I've learned. I paid $200 for this app and am completely disappointed... it is confusing. And under genre, there is no Christian option.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback and understand your disappointment. It's great to hear you enjoyed the tuner and warm-up features! We value your suggestions for more guidance and song recommendations. Your input is important to us, and we‚Äôll keep it in mind as we strive to enhance the experience for users like you.

scraped_reviews.content: It's great. It's really helpful if you're a beginner, though maybe it'd just be my phone, but it can't pick up my guitar sometimes. It gets annoying but doesn't happen frequently. Edit: I thought I could at least get by lesson 2 without paying, but alas, I'm stuck with the basics, daily sessions, and songs I have played before.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your support and are glad you find the app helpful! It‚Äôs great to hear you're enjoying it as a beginner. We recognize the issues with guitar detection and lesson access, and encourage you to utilize the support options in the app for further assistance.

scraped_reviews.content: Just started a few days ago. Not bad, love how it asks for my preferred music genre and adapts accordingly. Sadly, doesn't always seem to pick up when I play the notes. Have to pick at the strings harder than I'd like, just for the app to acknowledge I'm playing them. And even then, sometimes it thinks I'm not getting the timing right.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback and are glad you're enjoying the genre adaptability! We recognize that the note detection and timing can be challenging, and we value your insights. Your experience is important to us, so feel free to explore the support options in the app for more help.

scraped_reviews.content: Please Please try to team up with original artists. This app is beyond amazing, however, the vocals are crippling the desire to play, on more than half of the songs. I would love full versions and melodies to more songs too, but otherwise I have nothing else negative whatsoever to say. you guys are really rocking it, and thanks to this app so am I. I have a theory on how you could make an incredible amount of subscribers too
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your kind words and valuable feedback! It's great to hear you're enjoying the app and having fun with it. Your insights on the vocals and song versions are noted, and we‚Äôre glad you're rocking it along with us!

scraped_reviews.content: So far I like the app, I find that it is really useful as someone who used to play guitar alot and is trying to get back into it. I notice occasionally it doesn't properly detect my chords even if I'm playing it right but this is thankfully rare. I also don't like that alot of the early songs you learn are the "simplified" version which doesn't sound like the song at all, I say go all the way or nothing. Worst part is they force you into a yearly subscription with no option to get out.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We really appreciate your feedback and if you are satisfied with our response, please consider updating your app rating on App Store or Google Play.

scraped_reviews.content: Spent about week with this app. The core is quite nice. I've been using it on my PC with an interface and on my phone. It does an okay job at picking up the notes. Sometimes it struggles when I play chords. I wanted to expose myself to some music theory, but the knowledge tree is quite shallow. It covers VERY little. It's missing a few features. For instance there is no distinction for muted notes. The songs are meh. On the PC side, keyboard shortcuts would nice for navigating songs (rewind and such). I love that it can use my interface with an ASIO driver. I saw from another review that if you start the trial, it puts you on a one year monthly plan if you don't change it. I looked at my account and that is the case. That's pretty cruddy! I know you want to sell your products but don't screw people over through obscurity :/ Overall, I like the app, but it leaves a lot to be desired. I'll probably come back to it in a few months or a year and see how it's come along.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback. We will definitely pass this on to our team.

Feel free to reach us at contact.yousician.com if you have questions.

scraped_reviews.content: I had given this app 5 stars at one point. But had to demote it. The program it self is a great way to learn guitar. The app is a technical mess however. Some songs are completely out of sync. And lately when I click on certain songs I get kicked backto the menu. I've been a loyal customer and advocate for yousician for about two years. But if these bugs don't get worked out I'm going have to pursue more traditional means of learning guitar. Fix you app gang.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Could you please contact us via help@yousician.com, so that we could investigate the issue and help you figure out what's wrong? Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I am so excited to learn to play the guitar and this app was outstanding (for about 2 weeks. Once I got to the lessons for the G chord and strumming most of the lessons won't load or when they do, I can only do the short practice exercises before the songs. When I select one of the songs to practice, an error pops up saying "Something went wrong". The issue occurs on my Android cell and my iPad. Very disappointed. The update ruined the app.

As free, it's lackluster. There's only 3 or so free, brief lessons before you have to pay. I understand maybe they have to pay for licenses to all the music, but my goodness, like there's not enough expensive subscriptions everyone already has. If it were less, sign me up! For everyone who's having issues with the speaker not picking up your guitar sound, the only way I got it to work was with an amp. Otherwise, it never picked up sound successfully.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We hear you about the limited free lessons and understand your frustration with the subscription cost. We appreciate your feedback on the speaker issue and will share this with our team for improvement.

scraped_reviews.content: Look, I really like how they tried to teach in this app. But they're basically just forcing you to get the subscription. They're limiting your practice time, they're limiting the songs that you learn. Can you at least make the people that did not buy the subscription, have some songs that we will actually like. And I really think they can do more of this. It would be good to teach us the notes, how to read sheet music, and so much more. I think this app has lot of potential. But it needs 2 chang
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. We used our user‚Äôs feedback and the latest music-learning research to create a more user-friendly experience. You can find out more about the changes by visiting our Help Center to read the most Frequently Asked Questions here - https://support.yousician.com/hc/en-us/articles/360017755338

scraped_reviews.content: Works beautifully and is wonderful practice for any student... update I have been using this app for years. Paid 12.99 a month no problem. Worth it. Now the price has become phenomenal. Over 100 dollars up front to get the premium songs I had been getting for 12.99 a month. It's not really a guitar teacher using valuable time to teach. It's an app using ai and my resources to help me play. I'm sorry to say that as good as it is I can't pay this much. Once my monthly subscription I'll cancel
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we appreciate you taking the time to write your thoughts about the app and will keep your feedback in mind. Keep on rocking!

scraped_reviews.content: It listens as you play and teaches you to read tablature (tab) for guitar. Definitely well put together. Premium version has been fun too (since it's the only way to play "popular" songs). I've loved the Metallica course. I haven't tried other instruments. No technical issues except sometimes I think I hit a note and the app doesn't. I've heard that you can't cancel mid-year (but I wanted the full year), so read the fine print.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're glad to hear you're enjoying the app and the Metallica course! Your experience with note recognition is noted, and we appreciate your feedback on subscription details. Thank you for sharing your thoughts!

scraped_reviews.content: Not impressed. I wanted to try it out, but once I got past the tutorial, it kept asking for me to pay for a subscription. It wouldn't let me do anything, nor did it tell me if that was because I had to wait or watch an ad or anything. I understand getting the full experience requires payment, but come on. You give new users nothing at all, and you advertise it as a FREE app. Doesn't seem worth paying anyways, because there's few songs I saw that I liked. Very disappointed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,

There are plenty of rooms for changes and we are working on making Yousician a better tool for all music lovers! You may try signing up for the 7-day free trial i you like. You may cancel it when you feel like Yousician may not be the right tool for you. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: I tried the free trial, and it seemed to be a great and easy to use app, I just dont have enough time for it. So when I didn't cancel in time, of course they withdrew the money from my account. But all I had too do was contact customer service and they said my plan as been cancelled and they will refund my money into my account. It was easy and they responded fast. I would definitely highly recommend, I really wish I just had more time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're thrilled to hear about your positive experience with our customer service team! We appreciate your kind words and recommendation. Thank you for your support!

scraped_reviews.content: Had Rocksmith on 360 then ps4 and it never worked properly. It was supposed to be like guitar hero with real instruments. Not only does this app succeed completely wireless to boot. It has a number of instruments down to signing. Extremely impressed. Only con is I wish they had more recognizable songs even if they're covers, had full tab sheets if you didn't want to follow along with the music. Maybe add drums? Either way. This is worth your money!

So disappointed. I used to love this app, but now the developers are twisting our arms to buy the premium version. I used to be able to practice without the guiding pointers after my "free lesson time" was up (which is about 10 minutes by the way). Not ideal, but still works. Now I can't even do that. What an absolutely horrible update, seems like they've lost sight of the point of this app and their only concern is to force as much money as possible out of the app's users.

Was a nice app a year ago when I checked it out. Then my free trial subscription accidentally rolled into a YEAR LONG contract with no way out. I only just realized that even though I cancelled my account nearly a year ago, they have been charging my credit card $13.99 over the past 11 months. Cool. awesome. Not. Not the kind of company I would ever deal with again or recommend to anyone for any reason.

Good app. But I would like you to add some more metal bands as Korn, slipknot, Megadeth, more LP and Metallica, etc. I installed app b/c of Metallica, so disappointed that here is only few most recognizable songs. I think there is a lot of people who would download app to learn how to play songs from this genre. Because I don't listen to pop or classic light rock, so I'm not really interested to play em. Thanks for understanding
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Thank you for your feedback! The best platform for your suggestion is the Song request forum here: yousi.co/song-requests. Adding your song request on the Forum ensures that our content team hears about it first hand and has a better understanding of what the most wanted songs are. Thanks and keep on rocking!

scraped_reviews.content: Enjoying the app but refuse to sign up because of the year long commitment. I pay a higher monthly rate for other apps because I like the option to cancel any time. With this app, you will continue to be charged until completing a 12 month contract even if you cancel after 2-3 months. Nope! That's deceptive. Otherwise it seems like it would be really beneficial to the learning process. Even on first use, though, it frequently said I missed notes that I in fact hit, so that's troublesome...
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, The app has both yearly and monthly subscriptions available. While the yearly subscription does require a yearly commitment, the monthly plan can be canceled at any time without being charged again. In case that you have any other questions, feel free to contact us via contact.yousician.com at any time.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is amazing. Unfortunately I am only giving it three stars for two reasons. Reason one: the inconsistency of the free lesson time. Sometimes i get 6 minutes sometimes i get 10. Reaaon two: the premium plan. I would have absolutely no issue biying the plan if i had the option to not get locked into a full year. Aka if you pay for threee months and then cancel, there's no refund and you'll be charged for the full year anyways. Give me a month to month plan and youve got a subscriber!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,

The app has both yearly and monthly subscriptions available. While the yearly subscription does require a yearly commitment, the monthly plan can be canceled at any time without being charged again. You can find more about premium plans and pricing here: https://bit.ly/2yfoagE

scraped_reviews.content: I have picked up playing the guitar again after I took a long break from playing without any lessons/motivation. This app is fun, appealing, and very useful. It takes each element of the music and breaks it down, allowing you to follow at your own pace and really understand what you're doing. I'm only on day 5 and I already know more than I ever would have before, and I really enjoy playing. I am currently on the rhythm guitar path, thank you!

Great app! For people wbo want to learn guitars and such, but have never so much as held one prior to using the app. If only it included orchestral strings, such as violin, viola & especially cello. Starts with beyond basic exercises and very gradually moves up in difficulty, ensuring success to anyone willing to put in time and the slightest amount of effort. I love it. I have been regaining my bass skills and learning the guitar (which i always wanted to do but never got to).

It's a beautiful app, but everything seems to be locked behind a subscription paywall. Lesson transitions are ads with 15 second timers on them. After one lesson, time has run out for the day. >90% of songs are for premium members, and there's no filter to find free ones (But there's a premium filter?). Playing free songs even counts as lesson time! The ads are somehow more annoying than Spotify, and it really feels like the hefty subscription would make a big profit on temporary learners.

I will admit the app has a great concept. However I put in that I was already ok at playing guitar and the lessons it gave me included tuning the guitar and playing the frets insanly slow, the worst part in my opinion is that you have to pay to do more than a half hours worth of music at a time, and you can't even play most of the songs it shows you. I think they should put advertisements on some of the songs that you have to pay for so that you aren't stuck playing songs you've never heard of.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Thank you for your review! If you want to advance through the game faster, you can take our skill tests. You may find them under "Try to unlock level X" Skills tests are designed to determine the skill level for each student. Upon successful completion of a skill test, all previous content in the syllabus will be automatically unlocked.

scraped_reviews.content: Just started, but didn't have a good experience, so I uninstalled. The concept is cool, but I ran into too many issues. Half the time, the notes I played weren't picked up, no matter what I did, so the songs I was practicing would pause and wait, ruining the beat. There was no point in retrying because you only get a limited time to play before the app cuts you off (unless you want to play a lot of money every month.) As a beginner, this app is disheartening and just not worth it.

This app is a scam. If you want to sign up for the "$10/month" subscription, it doesn't tell you that it's really a $120 subscription for the year billed monthly so if you decide to cancel after a couple months it's too late you accidentally paid $120 for the whole year. I found out after the fact that it does tell you when you sign up in very small font that is barely a different color than the background so it's impossible to see. Also when you try to unsubscribe, it's not an option on the app and it's very hard to figure out how to do, but all along the way there are many options to "upgrade" to $170 per year. This all just screams obvious scam.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi James,

The app has both yearly and monthly subscriptions available. While the yearly subscription does require a yearly commitment, the monthly plan can be canceled at any time without being charged again. You can find more about premium plans and pricing here: https://bit.ly/2yfoagE

scraped_reviews.content: Beware! If you subscribe, you are forced into an annual contract and have to pay monthly even if you want to cancel. This plan was great when I had time to play, not now I don't and it's a waste of money. I am using this app to learn ukulele, and it's pretty fun. I have learned several chords and fingerings. What I'm not learning is independence. I can only play using the app's tablature and haven't learned how to read music in the real world.

They don't tell you that after the free trial, it's not a month to month subscription, but a year long subscription paid in monthly increments. I cancelled months ago, thinking I was done, only to see it still popping up on my credit statement. That's not money I can afford to be losing on a service I no longer have. Going to try and get the charges stopped, but others have said they refuse. Make sure you read the fine print before you give them your card info.

Do not pay for premium. This app is bad enough as a free tool, but paying for it is a waste of time. Limited song selection with annoying pop and country music, and unhelpful videos (you can find much better ones for free on Youtube). This app makes me dread practicing guitar, so I've stopped using it, but they make you sign up for an entire year.

At first I was so overjoyed to find an app that worked really well for my learning preferences. The lessons are simple to comprehend and enjoyable. Untill you reach the next session where you need premium to play a song but you can't move on until you have played that song. You might as well just advertise this app as NOT FREE instead of getting people's hopes up:/
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review. It would be great to be able to offer a free app for users. However, to keep improving the app and to add more content for you, paid memberships are needed. Please email us at help@yousician.com so that our team can help you check out the premium content in the app.

scraped_reviews.content: This is a fantastic resource. The lessons are nice and short, and you get lots of songs to practice each new technique. I'm perfectly satisfied using the free 10 minutes. And if you choose to subscribe, this app gives you a year of music lessons for the price of a month or two of in-person lessons. Come on, people. My one complaint is that there's no skill test for the knowledge section. I've done music my whole life, so it's annoying to sit through lessons on basics like pitch and tempo.

Great app. The teaching style works perfect for me personally. There are TONS of songs to play along with. **Update** After using the app for 6 weeks I still really like the program however I'm growing really frustrated with some of the songs and the singing / lyrics drowning out the guitar sound. You have an option to mute all music but that's it. I'd like to still hear the beat and all of the other music not the unnecessary lyrics.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Could you please contact us via help@yousician.com, so that we could investigate the issue and help you figure out what's wrong? Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Sketchy and way too difficult cancellation process. I would give this 5 stars, but the process of cancelling is very cumbersome and not user friendly at all. First of all, they bill you annually and there is no other choice. You are locked in to pay unless you remember when you started. This app is not cheap either, so you could be potential charged over 100$ if you don't time it right. When I tried to cancel, I couldn't do so through the app, which is dumb and shady. The website was problematic
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry to hear about the problem with cancellation. Could you please contact us via contact.yousician.com, so that we could investigate the issue and help you figure out what's wrong? Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Seems like a decent app but there's no way I'm spending that much to unlock the full version, as it's waaaay overpriced. There are 3 price options, 140 a year, 30 for a single month, and 14 per month for 12 months. 30 bucks for a month is ridiculous. I'd hesitate to spend 30 dollars on any app, much less one I only get to use for a month. I'd do the 14 a month to try it out, but you're locked in for a year if you do that so that would just be stupid if you're paying for a whole year anyway.

I really like this app! I'm 15, and I've had a guitar for 5 years. (My younger self recieved it as a birthday gift, having an obsession with guitars at the time.) I've never really been into stringed instruments, and always found them hard to learn. But this app made it really easy, and the tuner is accurate to the one that came with my guitar!

I've used "Guitar"Tuna" for years because the tuner portion of the app is easy to use and very accurate, but I never took the dive into Yousician. It's too expensive for what it is, and isn't. I decided to at least check out the free trial and it's clearly designed to force more accomplished players into paying so that they have an opportunity to test some of the more advanced features. I cancelled my trial same day.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for sharing your feedback with us.

scraped_reviews.content: Yousician is TERRIBLE on Android. It tells me EVERY note is late even when I play the note early. I play a series of the same note and it doesn't register a couple of them. I miss a note and it says I played it. This is very, very frustrating on its own, but maddening when there is way too long of a section! When it doesn't register all the notes, you cannot get past a section that takes 45 seconds to play at normal speed! Either fix the algorithms or shorten/break up very long passages.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your detailed feedback about the note recognition issues and understand how this can impact your practice experience. Your insights are important to us, and we're committed to improving the app's performance. Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us!

scraped_reviews.content: First off, this app isn't accurate at all. The mic would not recognize the correct notes and would constantly keep saying that you're playing it wrong. So, not very useful. Secondly, even AFTER cancelling they will still charge your card $13.95 every month for a year. So if you accidently forget to cancel the free trial in time watch out! They will charge the SHIZZ out of your card forever for this garbage app! STAY AWAY!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review! The best way to prevent the false positives and the red notes when you are sure you're playing it right, is to use the headphones. Please try it, and if the problem persists, contact us via contact.yousician.com, so that we could investigate the problem further. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: I have had this a few days, really enjoy it. I feel super accomplished that I got a 100% on the song. I like the daily goal. I wish there was a reminder notification because I missed a few days and could have used that extra nudge. Also, somehow I ended up not starting at the beginning and the flow isn't so clear. Wish that section was locked and I was alerted that I was accessing something above my current level.

The app is good itself but the payment options are very annoying. $30 for a single month or $12.99 a month but you're forced to pay that for a whole year. I'm not willing to throw down that high monthly premium for a month not do I want to be locked into something for a whole year. I dont remember this app being so expensive when I used to use it in the past. I'd get it if the monthly premium wasn't twice as much as the year contract. I'm sorry "commitment".

My experience has been solely with the Bass section of Yousician. When I first used the app I had already been playing for a year and was extremely impressed by what I saw. The video leasons are very clear and easy to understand and the basics section was very informative. But after that it was a huge let down. After completing the basics section the only tools available on the free version are the video lessons. No songs, only countless popups to buy their subscription. YouTube is a better bet
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Could you please contact us via help@yousician.com, so that we could investigate the issue and help you figure out what's wrong? Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: So, I'm nothing of a professional but I can say this app seems to be pretty good if you want to learn how to sing like me. My only issue is that if you don't have the premium subscription you can get locked out (timed?) if you use the app for too long. I would rather take ads every three lessons if I had the option. Besides that though, I really enjoy this app:) !

Just not really worth it in my opinion. The lessons I have Access to are fine for early beginners but the majority of content is locked behind a paywall, as far as I can tell this included any lessons past the "basics course", every song I found, and any additional content. This wouldn't be so bad if I felt the cost of a subscription was reasonable but I don't. I would understand locking copyrighted songs and additional content to non-subscribers but it isn't worth it for content I won't use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review. It would be great to be able to offer a free app for users. However, to keep improving the app and to add more content for you, paid memberships are needed. Please email us at help@yousician.com so that our team can help you check out the premium content in the app.

title: Kids Preschool Learning Games
description:
Kids Preschool and Kindergarten Learning Games: Fun and Free for Toddlers

Welcome to the world of kids games and learning games for kids. This app is the ultimate educational app for toddlers and young children.

This app has over 150 games that cover topics, such as:

Alphabets: Learn to recognize and write letters, spell words, and sing along to the alphabet song. This is one of the best spelling games for kids who want to master the ABCs.
Numbers: Learn to count, trace, and identify numbers from 0 to 10, and enjoy the balloon pop game with catchy sounds and music. This is one of the most fun games for kids 4 5 years old who love 123.
Colors: Learn to name and match colors, and unleash your creativity with coloring pages and drawing tools. This is one of the most colorful kids games and learning games for kids.
Shapes: Learn to recognize and draw basic shapes, and solve puzzles and memory games. This is one of the most challenging kids learning games and educational games for kids.
Vehicles: Learn to name and identify different types of vehicles, and play with car games and transport puzzles. This is one of the most exciting kids games and learning games for kids who love cars and trucks.
Body Parts: Learn to name and locate different parts of the body, and practice good hygiene habits. This is one of the most useful kids learning games and educational games for kids who want to stay healthy and fit.
Days and Months: Learn to name and order the days of the week and the months of the year, and understand the concept of time. This is one of the most important kids learning games and educational games for kids who want to plan ahead.
Musical Instruments: Learn to name and play various musical instruments, and enjoy the piano and xylophone games. This is one of the most musical kids games and learning games for kids who love to make some noise and have fun.
Animals: Learn to name and categorize different animals, and explore their habitats and sounds. This is one of the most adorable kids games and learning games for kids who love animals and nature.
Fruits and Vegetables: Learn to name and sort fruits and vegetables, and discover their benefits and tastes. This is one of the most delicious kids games and learning games for kids who want to eat well and be healthy.
Community Helpers: Learn to name and appreciate the roles of different community helpers, such as doctors, firefighters, teachers, and more. This is one of the most inspiring kids games and learning games for kids who want to help others and make a difference.
Environmental Science: Learn about the natural world and how to protect it, and play with interactive games and experiments. This is one of the most educational games for kids and learning games for kids who want to learn about science and the environment.
Bedtime Stories: Listen to soothing stories and lullabies that will help your kids fall asleep peacefully. This is one of the most relaxing kids games and learning games for kids who need a good night‚Äôs sleep.
Nursery Rhymes: Sing along to classic nursery rhymes and songs that will entertain and educate your kids. This is one of the most fun kids games and learning games for kids who love to sing and dance.
All the games are designed with interactive, helpful voice narrating, colorful graphics, and great sound effects that will keep your kids engaged and motivated. The games are also suitable for different age groups, from 2 to 5 years old, and can be adjusted to match your kids‚Äô skill level and learning pace.

This app is more than just an app. It‚Äôs a fun toy phone that will turn your smart phone or tablet into a learning device for your kids. It will help them develop their memory, concentration, logic, and creativity skills, and prepare them for kindergarten and beyond.

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to give your kids the best gift of learning and fun. Download Kids Preschool and Kindergarten Learning Games today and watch your kids grow and shine!

They ask me to give my card details for payment but whatever card I try from whichever bank it always says the card info is wrong. Is there any other way to do it. I have tried 3 different cards from 2 different banks. Debit cards.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear user, we are sorry for your inconvenience. All payments are handled by Google play Store and we just provide an interface to it. You can try other wallets or Google pay as well. Incase you need any help, write us at support@gunjanappstudios.com, and our technical team will help you

scraped_reviews.content: so far I like it I preview all my little girls apps I look for fun was for her to learn an see if it gets interrupted with pop up ads so far so good in her kids safe mode if there was a lot of ads she wouldn't be able to cause it would redirect to her home screen can't wait to see how it works for her

Paid for the app still getting adds great app but usless for toddlers i wouldnt of paid if i new it kept the adds. SCAM NO NOT used by more then one ID Yes this is used with the same Google ID Yes it is synced with the same Google I'd If I go into the app and try to purchase it again it says That I have already made the purchase. This game is in playable for toddlers due to the adds and a complete waist of money.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We would be more than happy to help. Please let us know the details 1) Is your device used by 2 or more Google Ids ? 2) When you open the app, do you use the same Google Id with which the app was purchased ? 3) Is your device setup under Parental Control profile ? If yes, is it synced with the same google Id with which the purchase was made

scraped_reviews.content: I choose to upgraded and pay not to get the ads, and now they don't pop up during the games but still pop up when my kid exits to pick something else to play. So annoying! All the ads are not worth this game when there so many others to choose from
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Sarah, Please restart the game that should fix the issue. If not, please write us at support@gunjanappstudios.com so that we can better assist you. Also please do provide as much info as you can. Thanks

scraped_reviews.content: It is all working fine but I contacted the email that ive seen here to ask how can I keep my subscription on the tablet, since the phone that I used to buy the subscription is broken and no one replied to the email, I gues now they can reply to this. Just wondering also why they can't detect my google account if I used it to the different gadget and asking to buy the premium while im using the same google account when I bought the premium for a year. thank you.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jendy, first of all we regret for the inconvenience caused, in here at GunjanApps we take issues very seriously and the team has been notified regarding your mail as well. Let us know in the mail of the id you are using, and the devices. Also restarting or reinstalling the game sometimes fixes the issue. üôÇ

scraped_reviews.content: After We pay the monthly subscription the app keep on asking to pay for premium on certain games. It should be specified if there are different types of memberships if there are any. It also says 3 day free trial but charges you right away

This app is awesome! My baby enjoys it. It can be use offline if I'm not connected to our wifi. It has a lot of educational stuff in store for your kids. I might purchase the premium option, once my baby perfect the games and quizzes.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review! Please recommend our app to your friends, and don‚Äôt hesitate to shoot us a note at support@gunjanappstudios.com if you have any questions.

scraped_reviews.content: All of the ads go across the bottom of the screen right where the choices are located. At least five times in one game my son has clicked ads instead of the choices. Otherwise a lot of the games are pretty educational.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, this is a free/trial version of the app and contains ads. We understand that ads are annoying, but once you explore and feel it is useful for your kid. You can easily upgrade it for an ad free version. Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: Haven't gone in depth yet with the game but looks interesting also the ads at the bottom of the game is hiding some of the letters n so on so if the ads can be smaller or there's a button to close them out thank you cause my child could see the last 4 letters of the alphabet
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your feedback with us, we are working on to fix the issue as soon as possible. Appreciate your patience.

scraped_reviews.content: This game was recommended by the teacher of my grandkid. I am so happy that I listened to her, my grandchild is so exited and is spending the screen time in a very productive way. The games are designed in such manner that they would not know that they are learning while playing. He is so hooked and always want my mobile to play.

The placement of the ads is ridiculous. They are always right at the bottom, placing them right where other buttons are. Makes my 2 year old mad because then he accidentally touches them and it brings him to another page.
great for teaching kiddos and helping them get ready for school

Lovely preschool game for kids. My kid has learnt so much with the help of this game. It's a complete package for 1-5 year old kids. 123 Numbers, ABC Alphabets, coloring games. Puzzles games, Coloring book, toddler games, kindergarten learning games, doodling, shapes and colors, Dual player games, Balloon pop. The best part is you can also customize games as per the year of your child. Extremely well designed game for kids. LOVED IT GOOD JOB TEAM üíØüëçüôÇüéÅü¶ÑüñºÔ∏èüé®üñçÔ∏è

Great educational preschool games for kids. My son's enjoy this very much. Nice learning activities and educational games along with it to keeps kids engaged and fun learning while they play. Not very expensive compared to other subscription as well.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
We are pleased that you enjoyed the app. If there is anything we can do for you, just let us know at support@gunjanappstudios.com!
Have a wonderful day!

scraped_reviews.content: This is a very interesting app because it allows kids to learn in a playful way which makes it more fun. It has a number of activities which also allows learners to cover a lot of educational development very fast. I can recommend it so that at the end of the day,many kids become covered.

This is very informative app for the pre school student. The app is awasome, they have desing such a wonderful way. My son has been useing this app since last 10 days, every day 100 times he is saying papa lets play ABCD. The one good thing is he is showing interest to learn things himself. One suggestion, In spelling game my son is dragging the letters rendamly, he should suppose to drag left to right order. Requesting to improve the game so that they can drag the lettter in only left to right.

Perfect for toddlers...my almost 3yr old son got bored quickly with the other learning apps within minutes but not this one. It's fun and he learnt very quickly. Everything he needed to know is right here to prepare him for preschool. Thank you for a great app. much appreciated.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Awesome !! Thanks for your review. We love when parents recognize our hard work and appreciate.

scraped_reviews.content: Love it! Concerned only about the monsters (my children get disturbed by monsters), but either than that the app is really a great help to me and offers me great ideas with the constructive play I have with the children. So really, thank you!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
We are pleased that you enjoyed the app. If there is anything we can do for you, just let us know at support@gunjanappstudios.com!
Have a wonderful day!

scraped_reviews.content: This app is good for the kids. There's a lot of option of games in this app that kids can learn basic knowledge. It also fun in how this app made, a funny pictures and also it's color that gave life on it. And it is easy to use for kids as I observe to my Lil brother Isaw how he learned and have fun while playing this kind of game app.

Not a good option, as parents should try to reduce screen time rather than Increasing it by providing apps. A child shoul learn through by other means like paper, slate, pencil, rather than giving them phone to learn numbers or letters.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! We deeply respect your advice, and we will try to combine your feedback with our R&D, in order to improve.

scraped_reviews.content: Its very nice app. Very interactive. But i can find the save photos in tracing the letters. Where can I find them? Because its my son's first try to trace so i save it but apparently i cant find the save the photos.

App is good. Lot of educational games . I have bought the premium also . But once the app got updated and it's asking to buy the premium again . My previous premium didn't expire yet . after app update the premium which I bought didn't show up . I have to buy it again . Can you please address this issue
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, can you please contact us at support@gunjanappstudios.com and we will gladly help you in resolving the issue.

scraped_reviews.content: I paid the $1.99 for the ad free version, because they were getting in the way of my daughter being able to play. Complete waste of money!! The ads are still there even after a system restart. I want my money refunded.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We would be more than happy to help. Please let us know the details 1) Is your device used by 2 or more Google Ids ? 2) When you open the app, do you use the same Google Id with which the app was purchased ? 3) Is your device setup under Parental Control profile ? If yes, is it synced with the same google Id with which the purchase was made

title: Business Insider
description:
The Business Insider app provides you with a fast and convenient way to read business news on the go.

Stay up-to-date with the latest news, sharp analyses and insightful commentaries from around the world and across a variety of topics like tech, finance, real estate, and more.

Key Features:
+ Receive breaking news alerts and follow developing stories
+ Follow the topics that matter to you with Shortcuts and access your favorite categories faster
+ Search through Insider's extensive news archives
+ Get full coverage on the latest and trending topics with our new, curated Discover feed
+ Save interesting articles for later reading
+ Share articles directly to your email or favorite supported social media apps (Facebook, Twitter, Pocket, Pinterest, WhatsApp, etc.)
+ Use summary mode to skim the key details of every article without leaving your home feed
This is a subscriber-exclusive feature.

We are always working to improve the overall app experience and welcome your feedback.

Feedback about the app: mobile@insider.com
Contact Insider subscriptions: subscriptions@insider.com
Contact our editors: feedback@insider.com

Thank you for reading!


Business Insider Subscription Agreement:

You are agreeing to purchase a subscription that includes access to articles and e-newsletter. Once purchase is complete, payment will be charged to your iTunes account upon confirmation of your subscription selection at the below prices (subject to change at a future time):

- Monthly subscription - $11.99/month
- Quarterly subscription - $27.99/Quarter
- Annual subscription - $99.99/year

* For non-US app stores, the equivalent currency charges will apply.

All subscriptions are set to renew automatically unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24 hours prior to the next billing date.Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase.
Terms of Sale: https://www.insider-inc.com/terms-of-sale

UPDATED PRIVACY POLICY:

We have updated our Privacy Policy to reflect global privacy standards. We encourage you to read the updated policy in full. By continuing to this app after April 13th, 2023, you agree to these updated terms. Privacy Policy is available at https://www.insider-inc.com/privacy-policy.

Additional Subscription Information:

‚Ä¢ Account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal.
‚Ä¢ Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase.
‚Ä¢ No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during the active subscription period.

‚Ä¢ Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.

Terms of Service - https://www.insider-inc.com/terms/

scraped_reviews.content: App does not recognize my paid subscription and wants me to renew; my subscription does not expire until September 24 its Feb 24 today; June 8th and app only works 1x after installing. I have to reinstall yo use and then it works only a few times and asks me. to resubscribe. definitely not renewing this app.

I love business insider for national and international information and opinions. Their subscription price of about $50 per year is very reasonable for the service they offer. The search function is a lifesaver. However, I have found it a bit frustrating when I can't remember the key words that work. In those cases I find myself paging thru the articles till I find the one I need.

This app is a complete waste of time. You're constantly bombarded with notifications for news articles that require premium to view, clicking on an article in your feed frequently takes you to the wrong article and requires an app shutdown, and every single article is written in the same zero effort format "Five things all millennials should know about saving for retirement, and five most of them don't!" Look elsewhere for your news.

I am a subscriber and am experiencing the same problems that everyone else has reported. Notifications and links will pop up the story for a second and then display "Article not Available". Their support is dismissive and they are not addressing the problem. Use a browser to read instead, or go somewhere else for your news that has a useful app.

Bait and switch. Put articles on Google to bring you in. Make you download their ap to read it, then force you to pay for the app after the first article. I understand economics. It's not based on our unlimited wants needs and desires. It's based on someone else's. I will not pay twice for a product. If I see ads, it should be free. If I pay, no ads. Pure and simple.

App crashes, freezes, and some of the articles are a bit bias...typical journalism I suppose but it's better then nothing. UPDATE: cannot access articles, continues to say there is an issue with the internet. All available articles are no longer relevant. Will uninstall this app as its only taking up RAM space.

O must have subscribed for some trial subscription, or it piggy back from other subscriptions, but out of nowhere, I have a charge on my account for this site. I have been trying for hours to figure out how to cancel it. Of course, conveniently, when you click for password reset, it takes you to a screen that has no option for the password reset. When finally found for reset, you need your current password. They make it so hard to cancel the subscription, which can't even find that option.

The app gives you a news notice, lets you read it for about two seconds, then tells you the article is unavailable. The app developers also don't know how to manage image caching, and my phone fills up with gigabytes of image previews for old news that I don't even look at anymore. This is absolutely the worst news app I've ever used. If an article is published and you receive a push notification, the article shouldn't disappear when you try to read it.

App is garbage and Google Play subscriptions don't work on website. I like BI's content. I subscribed through the Google Play store for convenience. When I am in the app, it shows I have an active subscription. However, when I log in online it shows that I do not have any subscription at all. Even worse, sometimes (randomly? inexplicably?) the app opens an in-app web browser and loads the website article, which, again, I can't access. Also the app cuts off almost every headline.

Same issues everyone else is reporting: app can't seem to recognize my subscription. Ill get a news alert, click it, and almost immediately be asked to sign in. Once go through the sign in process, I'm taken the the home page and not the article I was just in. Search function for the article doesn't work either. Super frustrating. I've tried Uninstaller and reinstalling and still experience the same issues. Super frustrating as I'm paying $100 for the BI content and can't easily access it.

The app is totally broken. Constantly says "article not available" when tapping on a notification. I pay monthly for premium access yet its still a struggle with this app to get to the stories. I have to use Chrome to view stories in the "prime" area. In fact, the app won't even let me sign in. The link doesn't even respond. I love BI but the app makes me want to just give up on them.

Love the article choices. Just wish the picture and video links worked better. Videos only seem to work about 50% of the time. UPDATE: now has WAY too many annoying advertisements like every other app. Was good while it lasted, just got greedy for more money and made the app too annoying with amazon offers every 10 seconds. Ug and now they charge to read some of the articles.

Worthless app. I have signed up with gmail for their prime membership through browser and it feels like an impossible task to sign in into this app. Everytime it asks to create a new password and then it does not work while log in. Update: Finally was able to log in, but their UI is so confusing that I do not know if I really signed in. And whenever I click on the links they send through my email, it asks to login each time. What the heck!

Poor app experience. I'll get notifications for articles and then when you click on them, the article loads for a few seconds and then you get a message this article is no longer available. I'm going to assume they aren't actually recalling every article they write and it's just a bad app. Good luck trying to use the search feature to find the article

I find Insider articles invaluable to my work...it's sad to see that you can't get this app thing right. I had hoped, upon subscription, that the app would be most useful to me on the go. All that should have been coded was a redirect to automatically log me into the app using my credentials. My advise, considering all the negative reviews you have here, apologize and take it down until you have fixed it!

The news is fine (it's no WSJ, but they have some interesting coverage now and again), but the app is horrendous. If I leave it open but lock my phone, it leaves the article I was reading and goes to the main page. Once on the main page, no amount of tapping opens an article. I need to close the app and reopen it in order to access articles. On reopening the app, the articles to select from have changed, so I now have to dig to find what I was interested in. All in all a horrible experience.

App fails the basic test of easy log in. It takes me a subscribe page and confirms I already subscribed but doesn't take me to the login page. Basic basic basic functionality that should have been tested in beta. For an app with this maturity it is unforgivable. I'm paying for an app I can't access. Still a month later. Google store - please remove this app. I'm paying but BI is blocking access.

When opening an article from email or notification, the app opens-opens the article-then quickly shows "this article is not available-check your internet". I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app, been on Wi-Fis and cell service, and if I search for the article (which search isn't great) and open it it works fine - but I can never open an app from an external notification or email. Finally I can't optionally sign into my subscription through Google (FB&another only). Articles are great though

So far I really like the app, all relevant news easily readable with the option to summerize each article so only key points are displayed. The option to search for specific articles is very user friendly, and the ability to save important articles makes it a breeze to refer back to. Not too flashy, with key information and simple usability. Keep up the good work!

The one thing that bothers me about this app is that I was trying to make an account and subscribe, but I couldn't find any place to do that or any clear cut details about what the subscription would cost me. I haven't read much of the content, but the headings are intriguing. I think it should be more personalizes and focus more on the consumer rather than a variety of different branches of the company. It's like it's trying to do too many things at once but quantity doesn't equal quality.

BI used to be a great App top 3 on my phone but I had to delete it. Most annoying was links to wrong article, the quality of journalism went way down borderline tabloid and with that there is no way I could justify paying even a fraction of what they wanted for premium membership. Sad you let it come to this!

The app isn't supporting OAuth2 for Google login on my phone. Extremely frustrating - after paying subscription and getting suggestions from Google on articles to read and not being able to login to read them is very frustrating. I havent been able to use the app since I paid for it. Very bad experience. Will cancel subscription If not rectified.

Business insider is an amazing source of information with informed and intelligent writing. So I will stay until this becomes 5 stars. On my pixel 3 XL the app is crazy buggy and the flagship link from the scroll screen to the article has never worked. Even though I am a premium subscriber, I often get the error messages of non subscribers. One of the reasons I subscribe is to avoid inconvenience. I can always take a few minutes and find the article for free somewhere, but I would rather pay.

For an app of this type, this is quite a shoddy piece of work for such a large company! Apart from the fact that it's not greatly presented, the biggest issue I have with this stupid app is: if I see an article that I'd like to read and I click to read it, SHOW ME THE ARTICLE I CHOSE TO READ, NOT A DIFFERENT ONE! SERIOUSLY??? That's the type of amateur programming that shouldn't exist these days anymore!

The best stories are the ones in the newsletter. The articles unlocked with the subscription are boring and irrelevant. Then when you try to cancel, they don't give an option on the website or the app. Do not bother with this app or a payed subscription. Just subscribe to the free newsletter.

Great article content and organized display. Clean GUI and I love the variety of sources. Great for business articles, politics, international news and fun stories. UPDATE 2/27/2020 After BI applied major changes to their GUI design to include BI-Prime, the BI app got rid of my saved articles. The latest version would give me a notification and if not clicked immediately the article would not be found. Lastly, links would be clicked and send me to other articles. So frustrating. REMOVING APP!

Used to be my favorite source of business news, but has continually been increasing the frequency of bad/stupid/childish articles (e.g., "step-by-step guide to writing a paper check"). Still some good articles, but drowned out now by the worthless ones, and the best now require a paid subscription.

App is good,could be better. I would rate it at 5 stars, but it has a very serious bug issue, the app keeps logging me out randomly while reading articles, it freezes on me while reading some stories, and some stories are spread out and blank. Fix these issues and I would give it a 5 star rating.

Worst experience from the past six months. The app interface changes often and sometimes it shows half baked news. In addition to all of this, I can find a lot of grammatical and spelling errors in the articles. I am giving one star not for the news but the way you are presenting them.

many of the articles that are displayed on BI display a brief summary that requires a subscription to the originating source such as BI Prime, Barron's or WSJ, etc in order to read the full article. The problem is that there is no notification of this fact until after you begin reading. I find this so annoying to waste my time clicking on articles that go nowhere. BI should indicate upfront that a subscription is required so readers dont waste their time on these, in effect, advertisements.

YOU WILL BE STUCK I tried the trial but was not really impressed. Fliboard is free and has better scope... I went to cancel my subscription and you literally cant! Selecting Subscription on the app opens you up to picking a new subscription on the web, trying the same on the web is impossible. You can't even log out!

I solely downloaded this app to give Business Insider a bad rating. But the rating is due to its desktop site. It will not let me see anything because of an ad-blocker. I disabled it from running on all BI sites, the ads even showed up, and it still keeps giving me the pop-up. I then remove the ad-blocker altogether and clear the browsing data. Guess what? STILL SAYS I'M USING AN AD-BLOCKER. You care so much about money but lost a viewer because of this - now no ads at all.

The news is good but the app experience is bad. I cannot believe there is no option for Dark Mode nor does it support landscape viewing. Not supporting landscape viewing renders the app useless for me on my tablet. I don't use my tablet in portrait mode. Please fix or I will not renew my annual subscription that I just signed up for today. I should have checked on the app first!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Dominic, thanks for your feedback. We are looking to add new features such as dark mode to our app, and have recently come out with landscape viewing on tablets. For any other issues/concerns please contact subscriptions@insider.com.

scraped_reviews.content: PLEASE CANCLE MY MY SUBSCRIPTION!! I SELECTED NO AND IT STILL CHARGED ME!!! $150/year for some news you can read anywhere? What a joke!!!!! THIS IS LITERALLY STEALING!! I would consider paying $20/yr if the app was anywhere even remotely half decent but this app is literal junk. Biz insider should seriously fire their UI team. And to be charged randomly because I signed up for the trial is ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS!! YOU SHOULD BE REMOVED FOREVER FROM THE APP STORE AND SUED! YOU CANT STEAL!!

The content is pretty good, but the app is terrible. First, content is not properly refreshed in the app forcing manual refreshes. Second, clicking on notifications almost always results in an error that the article is not available despite the fact that you can find the same article by scrolling the feed...usually after manually refreshing the feed.

Great articles, but the app is horrendous. It's slow, glitchy, and the subscription from the app does not sync with my account, saying that I'm still unsubscribed, even after I paid for BI prime. Seriously if you want to become a paid app, at least get the payment part working properly.

Push notifications are useless since clicking on them results in a "Article not found" error. And then its difficult to find the article on the feed. This has been happening for awhile and mentioned in many reviews. Seems like app development is lacking.
The new app does not open articles inside articles, just hang in there.

Love the content, but app no longer works on my phone. I have to access the articles using a browser now. The number of articles I can access using a laptop is sporadically limited. I hope they sort these technical issues. I will a access their content as long as it is available.

The Insider app has crashed without opening every time on my Pixel 7 Pro running the latest version of Android 13. It's the first issue I've had with it, and even uninstalling and reinstalling it didn't help. I'm leaving it off until some time in the future when it will hopefully be upgraded and fixed.

I love Business Insider's content; however, the app can be better designed. 1. The night mode uses blue hyperlinks which are very difficult to read. I often finding myself switching between the night and the day modes just to read the hyperlinked texts. 2. The app lags on articles that contain many pictures and ads. My phone struggles the more I scroll down in such articles. Phone: Samsung Galaxy S8

The app has not opened for me for over 2 months. Before I had problems while using the app where it was closing by itself, now it doesn't even pass the insider logo. It hasn't been working for a while, which makes me think the team doesn't care for their subscribers, unfortunately

Used the app for at least a year. Now when I click on articles it says I ran out of free views. New update maybe? The articles aren't good enough to pay for in my opinion. The information can be found somewhere else and that's where I'll go
I like their reporting and in depth stories.

Some technical question: everytime I click your article sent through notification, I get a msg saying, "Article is not available at this time. Please check your internet connectivity and try again". If you could kindly look into it, it'd be great. Thank you.

You put a clip of an article on my Google feed and, since I wanted to read it, I installed the app, but, when I clicked on it to read the rest, I couldn't find the article! That seems to be a ploy to get people to subscribe! Uninstalling!

Most of the time notifications lead to "premium" articles you won't be able to read unless you pay a subscription, I guess that's ok if you're interested in paying a subscription, otherwise is a waste of time.

It keeps crashing. It locks up. The user can't turn off the listing of premium content getting stuck in your face. Oct 9, 2019 now it failed to load general content even after reloading app. Do yourself a favor, get news from other sources.

one of the most stupid apps out there. you get an email with a list of stories and you click on a story, but rather than being taken to the app, you are taken to the web browser and told that this is a 'Prime' story and can't be accessed. Moreover, you can't even search for that story on the app, because it doesn't let you search anything. what a mess!!!

Terrible app. I have a subscription and never recognizes it, keeps asking me to pay again. When you click on a notification article, the article is almost never available. You would think someone as serious as BI would have a great app in the digital age...

title: Snapchat
description:
Snapchat is a fast and fun way to share the moment with your friends and family üëª

SNAP 
‚Ä¢ Snapchat opens right to the Camera ‚Äî just tap to take a photo, or press and hold for video.
‚Ä¢ Express yourself with Lenses, Filters, Bitmoji and more! 
‚Ä¢ Try out new Lenses daily created by the Snapchat community!

CHAT 
‚Ä¢ Stay in touch with friends through live messaging, or share your day with Group Stories.
‚Ä¢ Video Chat with up to 16 friends at once ‚Äî you can even use Lenses and Filters when chatting!
‚Ä¢ Express yourself with Friendmojis ‚Äî exclusive Bitmoji made just for you and a friend.

STORIES
‚Ä¢ Watch friends' Stories to see their day unfold.
‚Ä¢ See Stories from the Snapchat community that are based on your interests.
‚Ä¢ Discover breaking news and exclusive Original Shows.

SPOTLIGHT
‚Ä¢ Spotlight showcases the best of Snapchat!
‚Ä¢ Submit your own Snaps or sit back, relax, and watch.
‚Ä¢ Pick your favorites and share them with friends.

MAP 
‚Ä¢ Share your location with your best friends or go off the grid with Ghost Mode.
‚Ä¢ See what your friends are up to on your most personal map when they share their location with you. 
‚Ä¢ Explore live Stories from the community nearby or across the world!

MEMORIES 
‚Ä¢ Save unlimited photos and videos of all your favorite moments.
‚Ä¢ Edit and send old moments to friends or save them to your Camera Roll.
‚Ä¢ Create Stories from your favorite Memories to share with friends and family.

FRIENDSHIP PROFILE 
‚Ä¢ Every friendship has its own special profile to see the moments you‚Äôve saved together.
‚Ä¢ Discover new things you have in common with Charms ‚Äî see how long you‚Äôve been friends, your astrological compatibility, your Bitmoji fashion sense, and more!
‚Ä¢ Friendship Profiles are just between you and a friend, so you can bond over what makes your friendship special.

Happy Snapping!

‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢

Please note: Snapchatters can always capture or save your messages by taking a screenshot, using a camera, or otherwise. Be mindful of what you Snap!

For a full description of our privacy practices, please see our Privacy Center.
